She started banana farming with her husband for survival and also to care for their children. This business grew and helped them to sustain their family and support education for her young sisters. She later obtained a loan of ugx.1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from UGAFODE which has helped them to increase her production and modernize her plantation. This motivated them to mobilize their fellow farmers to form a development group called Rwentobo Tutungukye. This group has also succeeded in other development projects, and they are requesting a loan of ugx.9,100,000 to help them increase their working capital for their different businesses. Abigil will use hers to buy organic fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.use: To buy organic manure for a banana plantation

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: Grupo está conformado por cuatro socias, ella es Ana mujer de 38 años de edad, acompañada, con tres hijos de 22,10 y 8años respectivamente , su  negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, Zelsa, venta de fritanga los fines de semanas, desde hace 6 años, este crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de cosméticos como perfumen de varón, perfumen de dama, lociones, champo, delineadores, máscaras, pintura de uñas,  pinturas de labios, tintes para pelo, desodorantes, cremas para cuerpo, cremas para cabellos, cremas faciales, cremas para los pies etc. Matha tiene 33 años su negocio es la venta de bisuterías y variedades, Francisca tiene 32 años su negocio es la venta de cajeta y arroz de leche, María tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y zapatos.
texts.en: This group s made up of four members. One member's name is Ana. She is a 38 year old woman who is married and has three children, aged 22, 10 and 8. Her business is selling Avon and Zelsa cosmetics and selling fritanga for 6 years. She will invest this loan in buying cosmetics, such as men's cologne,   on weekends. She will invest this loan in buying cosmetics such as men's cologne, women's perfume, lotions, shampoo, eyeliners, mascara, nail polish, lipstick, hair dye, deodorant, body cream, hair cream, facial cream, foot cream, etc. Matha is 33 years old. Her business is selling jewelry and varied items. Francisca is 32 years old. Her business is selling dulce de leche and rice puddine. María is 35 years old and her business is selling new clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to invest in buying Avon cosmetics such as men's cologne, women's perfume, lotions, shampoo, eyeliners, mascara, nail polish, lipstick, hair dye, deodorants, body cream,  hair cream, facial creams, foot cream, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is involved in selling pepper, bread, cassava, and other food items in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a construction worker) support their five children. She has been involved in selling pepper, bread, cassava, and other food items for six years now. She plans on using her loan to purchase pepper, bread, cassava, and other food items, thus helping her to sell more. She aspires to use her profits to both better market her food items enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase pepper, bread, cassava, and other food items for her food stall.

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mana se encuentra en el ciclo 14, es un comité excelente han demostrado siempre actitud de salir adelante en todos sus emprendimientos, son muy unidas, emprendedoras y están con las mejores expectativas de seguir creciendo y mejorando su vida.
Blanca es integrante de este grupo, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano en lo cual le está yendo muy bien, y gracias a lo cual está ayudando a su familia. Es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha y quiere mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de segunda mano para poder venderlo y seguir ayudando a su familia de la misma forma en que viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named Mana is in its 14th cycle. It is an excellent committee. They have always had a good attitude for getting ahead in all of their enterprises. They are very united and enterprising and have the best expectations to keep growing and improving their lives.  

Blanca is a member of this group and she says that she works selling used clothing, which is going very well for her. Thanks to this, she is helping her family. She is a very enterprising woman who is a fighter and who wants to improve her and her family's life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying second-hand clothing to sell and continue helping her family in the same way that she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with two children. She has received schooling until the end of junior high school. Currently, Betty sells clothes in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about two years now. Her husband is a construction worker. Betty’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Betty will use the loan to increase her existing clothes inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Betty plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing clothes inventory for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is single and has one child. After successfully graduating senior high school, Selina is now an established businesswoman. She sells clothes in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about one year. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Selina uses her income to provide for the entire family. Selina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Selina plans to diversify the type of products that she sells; hence, adapting to the changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of clothes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Agapao 1 Group

texts.en: Annie, aged 41, is a single mother of four children between the ages of nine to 22 years old. All four are attending school. She is representing the Agapao 1 Group. Annie sells smoked fish at a stand in the market. She has had this business for 20 years! She will use the loan to buy more smoked fish. She has gained many valuable customers over the years. Her business strategy is to sell to these loyal customers. Annie has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue her business far into the future. She hopes her children will find jobs working in an office.

loans.use: to pay for smoked fish.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en: Even though Yvette grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Yvette is an entrepreneur. She sells onions in Adentem (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 12 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their four children. Yvette has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more onions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yvette wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more onions to sell in her food stall business.

loans.name: Gonzalo Enrique

texts.es: Gonzalo, un hombre de 56 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos, a los cuales ha sacado adelante solo, ya que nunca se casó. Desde joven conoce las labores agrícolas porque ha vivido siempre en el campo. Actualmente tiene cultivos de caña y café en un pequeño terreno de su propiedad, cuando recoge la cosecha la vende y es así como logra generar ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. “A mí me gusta mucho el campo, mis hijos y mi trabajo me motivan para luchar todos los días para salir adelante, a veces es muy duro porque los insumos son muy costosos y además el clima es muy incierto y a veces me daña los cultivos”; con estas palabras, Gonzalo expresa las dificultades por las que ha pasado, pero esto no lo desanima y siempre logra superar los obstáculos. Por esto busca apoyo con el crédito, que desea invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas, semillas) para continuar realizando la actividad que le permite generar ingresos. Gonzalo tiene como meta ampliar sus cultivos para tener una cosecha más abundante y de esta manera tener los recursos suficientes para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Gonzalo is a 56 year old man. He is the father of 4 children whom he has gotten ahead alone, since he never married. Since he was young, he has known about agricultural work because he has always lived in the country. Right now, he has sugar cane and coffee crops on a little plot of land he owns. When he harvests the crop, he sells it and that is how he generates income to support his home. “I like the country a lot. My children and my work motivate me  to fight every day to get ahead. Sometimes it is very hard because the materials are very expensive and the weather is very variable and sometimes it harms my crops". With these words, Gonzalo expresses the difficulties he has gone through, but this doesn't discourage him and he is always able to overcome obstacles. That is why he is seeking help with the loan. He wants to invest it in buying agricultural materials (fertilizer, pesticide, fungicide, and seeds) to continue doing the activity that allows him to generate income. Gonzalo has as a goal to expand his crops to have a more abundant harvest and in this way have enough resources to offer his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials (fertilizer, pesticide, fungicide and seeds).

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a small scale ‘kenkey’ seller (kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a construction worker. Ruth has been preparing and selling ‘kenkey’ for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize, thus allowing her to meet customers’ rising demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a ‘kenkey’ stand; hence, helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize, thus allowing her to meet customers’ rising demands.

loans.name: Al-Abad Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Abad and is made up of four women. They live in Taiz, Yemen. They took a loan of 180,000 YER. Maha is 41-years-old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. The main hardship that she faces is the lack of money. So, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase a fridge to preserve foods. Maha is the leader of the four members; she hopes to offer her family a good life and own a good business to distribute her goods around her area.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge to preserve food.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 38-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in the business of selling chocolates and nuts for eleven years. In  2010, he opened his own shop to develop his family's socioeconomic situation. Kamal is a hard worker, well known in his region for his quality of products served and sold. He is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase his merchandise with special offer products to sell at competitive prices. 
Kamal likes his work, and is dedicated to developing it as much as he can. He hopes to develop it more in the future by opening a chocolate factory.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special offer products to sell at competitive prices for his chocolate and nut selling business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: After graduating primary school, Diana decided to set up her own second hand clothing business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over six years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more second hand clothing for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a mechanic) with the up-keep of their house whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Betty is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling oranges in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Betty is married and has four children. Her husband works as a mechanic. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Betty wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of oranges. In the long term, Betty plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of customers' rising demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of oranges at her food stall.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary operates a second-hand clothing business in ADENTEM (near Cape Coast). Mary is a widow with four children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mary uses her income to provide for the entire family. Mary will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothing, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a Junior High School graduate, Mary understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Mary is a successful businesswoman. She sells palm oil and cassava in ADENTEM (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mary uses her income to provide for the entire family. Mary will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of palm fruit and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of palm fruit and cassava

loans.name: Agapao 2 Group

texts.en:
Philclarez, age 28, is married with two children, ages 3 and 7 years old. They are both attending school. He is representing the Agapao 2 group. Philclarez grills meat and sells it in his community. He has been operating this business for four years. He will use the loan to buy more cartons of meat to grill. His business strategy is to grill in the morning when everyone is out. His customers buy the meat to eat for lunch or take home to eat for dinner. 

Philclarez has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. Philclarez hopes to buy a freezer and generator in the future in order to store the raw meat. He also wants to open a large restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to pay for cartons of meat.

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru: Мукаддаму 43 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Мукаддам вместе со своей семьёй живет в сельской местности. Она более 18 лет занимается скотоводством. Данное время она имеет 7 голов крупно - рогатого скота. Она продает на местном рынке скот, которого откармливала несколько месяцев. Также она продает молочные продукты как молоко, кефир, сметану и т.п. на местном рынке и соседям. На полученные деньги она покупает продукты питания для содержания семьи. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и с такой целью она обращается за займом в сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mukaddam is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. Mukaddam lives with her family in the countryside. She has practiced cattle husbandry for more than 18 years. She currently has seven cows. She sells cattle, which she has fattened up for several months, at a local livestock market. She also sells dairy products such as milk, kefir, sour cream, etc. to her neighbors and at the local market. With the received money, she buys groceries to feed her family.  She wants to increase her current assets and for that purpose she has requested a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness and relies on your charity.

loans.use: to increase her current assets in order to buy cattle.

loans.name: Agapao 3 Group

texts.en:
Marie, age 53, is married with two children, ages 26 and 30. She is representing the Agapao 3 group. Marie makes homemade fruit juice and sells it in the market. She has been doing this for six years. She will use the loan to buy sugar, fresh fruit, and packaging materials. Her business strategy is to walk around to different congested areas with her juice kept cold in portable coolers. She is able to sell a lot in one day if she visits many busy areas. 

Marie has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to export her juice to other countries one day.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, fruit, and packaging materials.

loans.name: Ragheb

texts.en:
Ragheb is 54 years old and comes from Nablus. He is married and has six children; two of them attend school and one is a university student. He has owned a blacksmith workshop since the year 2000 and has one employee.

Ragheb asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a compressor, a welding machine, and scissors for his blacksmith workshop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the scope of his work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, a welding machine, and scissors for his blacksmith workshop.

loans.name: Taan

texts.en:
Taan, a 36-year-old married father of one, has had his own convenience store for six years now. It is his family's sole source of income because his wife stays home to take care of her beloved family.

Taan is strongly motivated to develop his business in order to meet his family's current and future needs, which include enrolling his baby in school when it is time; he is planning a bright future for his family, which requires him to work very hard to achieve success.

Taan is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise diversity and buy a car that will help him transport his goods from wholesale shops to his store. He is also thinking of starting a cash van business, but needs to study this further before making a final decision.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise and buy a car to transport his goods

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза с детства всегда мечтала быть учительницей родного языка и литературы. В школе она училась отлично. Она активно участвовала во всех мероприятиях школы. Шахноза после окончания средней школы поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет в факультет Таджикская филология. Она учится успешно. Шахноза должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: From childhood, Shahnoza has always dreamed of being a Tajik language and literature teacher. She studied very well in school. She actively participated in all school activities. After graduating from high school, Shahnoza was accepted to Khujand State University in the Tajik language department. Her studies at university are going very well. Shahnoza should pay for her tuition, but she does not have the money. She is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy one big bag of maize that she will use to prepare kenkey with fried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add milk cows.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells yams in ADENTEM (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married to a driver, and together they have 4 children. 

Abena uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Abena will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of yams, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of yams, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Alibha Group

texts.en:
The name of this Joint Liability Group is “Alibha.” This group was formed in the year 2011, comprising six active and able women of Bolangir town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India. 

Sunita is one of the members of this group, and she is standing second from right with raised hand in the photo. She is a very head strong, confident lady with noble thoughts who possesses a strong determination for the development of her family. She has also an inclination to do something for society, especially in the field of education. She is 28 years old; living with her husband and a son, who is four years old. 

Sunita has been running a tailoring center in her residence for eight years. She has two sewing machines of her own and takes orders for stitching of ladies garments. Apart from that, she and her husband are working as teachers in a private English medium school of the town. 

This is the second loan of Sunita from Mahashakti Foundation. With the previous loan, she purchased her second sewing machine. Sunita earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR, which makes it very hard for her to manage her family and the tailoring center. Therefore she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income by using her leisure time. 

From the present loan she wants to purchase materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. She hopes to give better education to her only child. She has also a noble thought of establishing a tailoring training center.
 
The other five members of this group are Bhanu and Satyabhama, with bamboo hand fan selling businesses, Manjula and Anjali, with vegetable vending businesses and Santi, with a rice and puffed rice business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Monteha Group

texts.en:
Monteha group consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Khwla is a 19-year-old single woman. She is very hardworking and is doing her best to earn money. She intends to renovate her house. She decided to help her family and applied for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She hopes that their life conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house.

loans.name: Kaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 34-year-old single man from Jenin. He lives in a small house in the city with his family. Khaled works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This income is barely cover his needs. Khaled is studying for a master's degree in the university now.

Khaled requested a USD loan from FATEN. This will help him to pay the university installments this semester so he can complete his study and take his master's degree.

loans.use: to pay the university installments this semester.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима великолепная женщина и заботливая мать 3 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Им 25, 22 и 19 лет. Рахима посвятила свою жизнь своим детям. Она каждую минуту думает о них и их образование. Рахима вырастила своих детей честно заработанными деньгами. Она более 12 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Данное время она работает в ателье и преподносит свои услуги на высшем уровне своим клиентам. Она дополнительно шьёт платья дома. Рахима хочет помочь своим детям для улучшения их условия проживания. С такой целью она намерена увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки ткани, нитки и другие принадлежности для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahima is a wonderful woman and caring mother of three children. Her children, aged 19, 22, and 25, are all grown up. Rahima has dedicated her life to her children. Every minute, she thinks about them and their education. Rahima raised her children on honestly-earned money. For more than 12 years, she has offered her services as a seamstress. Currently, she works in a tailor shop and presents her high-level sewing skills to her clients. Additionally, she sews dresses at home. Rahima wants to help her children  by improving their living conditions. For that goal, she is determined to increase her earnings. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy fabric, thread, and other materials to increase her current assets. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, thread, etc. to increase working capital

loans.name: Issouf

texts.fr:
Mr ISSOUF est né  vers 1969 à Gningoni Cercle de Sikasso. Il vie dans une famille nucléaire avec ses enfants et son épouse à Kadiolo dans le quartier Noumousso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il mène des activités d’achat stockage vente de céréales  depuis plus de 7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 6eme prêt  et les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat d’environ 30 sacs de 50 kg de céréales constituée de mil et de maïs. Il s’approvisionne à Kadiolo et à Zégoua. Les ventes sont faites à Kadiolo. Les céréales achetées sont stockées dans son magasin à Kadiolo pendent une bonne période.  Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes du village. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste  afin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients qui ne cessent de croître
texts.en:
Mr ISSOUF was born around 1969 in Gningoni Cercle de Sikasso. He lives in a nuclear family with his children and his spouse in Kadiolo in the neighborhood called Noumousso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

His business has been buying, stocking and selling cereals for seven years. His experience in this domain affords him a good reputation and he gets orders from various clients. Thus, in order to have at hand the resources to satisfy his clients, he collaborates with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his sixth loan and the five prior loans were correctly reimbursed. 

This loan will allow him to buy around 30 sacks of 50 kg of cereals: millet and maize. He buys his stock in Kadiolo and Zégoua. His sales are made in Kadiolo. The cereals he buys are stocked in his warehouse in Kadiolo for a good while. His clientele is composed of men and women from the village. 

With this loan, he expects to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 F CFA each month. This profit will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and reinvest the rest in his activity. He intends to become a wholesaler so that he can satisfy the needs of his ever-growing and numerous clientele.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
After graduating primary school, Janet  decided to set up her own soft drink business in Adentem (near Cape Coast). With over five years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. 

Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more soft drinks for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a soldier) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Wala Group

texts.en:
This group is called Wala. It consists of four women. They have applied for a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB in order to solve their immediate financial problems. 

Raja is the leader of this group. A native of Taiz, Yemen, she is a 29-year-old married woman with six children, some of whom are attending primary school. She makes every effort to rear her children well. 

She has a small house and would like to renovate the house. She has requested this loan in order to buy building materials to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 53 years old, married, and lives with his wife and retired mother in the Tkibuli district. The family has income from an Internet cafe run by Merab in his district. The existing revenue is only enough to cover everyday expenses. So, Merab decided to start up a grocery store to increase the family income, but he needs financial support to implement his plan. 

Unfortunately, Merab lacks access to financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. He received credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $2,500,  Merab will purchase basic groceries for starting a grocery store. His wife will work as a saleslady. With this assistance, the family will receive additional income and expand their business gradually. Merab awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries for resale.

loans.name: Pavlina

texts.en:
Pavlina owns a little internet café in the village where she resides. She also operates an agricultural/livestock business.
Pavlina wants to buy milk cows with the loan she is requesting through Kiva lenders.
“I am twenty six years old and married and have a two year old baby. My husband and I work very hard, and everything we do, we do together. We’ve got dreams that we want to make reality and this is where the drive comes from. We both like living in the village, it’s nice. You can breathe fresh air as soon as you open your eyes. Money cannot buy this. W did not have the money needed to get higher education to do something better so we are content with our living and our choices for the moment;” Pavlina said.

loans.use: To buy additional dairy cows

loans.name: Majesty's Group

texts.en:
The Majesty's group is made up of six women who live in Dansoman. The members are very kind and courteous and work hard every day to improve their households' stability. They have various jobs to provide for their families. They sell wax-print, maize, underwear, cooking oil and second-hand clothing

One of the group members is Emelia. She is taking out her first loan with her friends and fellow members of the Majesty's group. She is 32, married, and has three children, ages 6, 4, and 2. They live in their own home.

Emelia is an expert wax-print seller with eight years experience. She learned this from her mother when she was 20, and she resorted to this trade in full when she got married. She works Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule. 

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of more wax-print to sell so that she can reach her goal of expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more wax-print fabric to sell.

loans.name: Mouhana

texts.en:
Mouhana is a 36-year-old married woman, the mother of three children. She started working a two years ago baking saj bread at home to improve their living conditions.

She is a hard worker who knows that she has to improve her business a lot to keep on helping her husband cover their family's expenses.

Her house is her workplace. She sells her products to retail shops, groceries, convenience stores and many other different individual customers. Her bread is very tasty, say her customers, and she is very clean in her work.

Mouhana applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her flour capital to produce more bread and cover her children's needs.

This is Mouhana's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan helped her a lot in improving her living situation to a healthy living medium.
As for the future, Mouhana is working hard to open her separate bakery to expand her business and increase her income. At the same time, she will be improving her family's living area.

loans.use: to increase her flour capital to produce more bread and cover her children's needs.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mistica está en su 2° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, en donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y 8 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy escasos y bajos.
Balbina trabaja en este grupo,  y comenta que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales. Es una mujer muy sacrificada, que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto y gracias a lo cual está ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales ya que este es su principal insumo y quiere tenerlo para seguir con sus ventas. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe de crecer y seguir ayudando a su familia, a la vez que se encuentra superando su pobreza.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mistica group is in its second cycle in the Women's Program. They are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty; eight of them are under the poverty line, which means they have very low incomes.
Balbina is part of this group and tells us that she sells natural remedies. She is a very self-sacrificial woman who is very proud of what she does; it is a dignified, honest occupation, and she is able to help her family through it.
She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of natural remedies, since this is her main product and she wants to have it in order to keep up her sales. She is grateful for this opportunity to grow and continue helping her family, and she is overcoming poverty.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine for sale.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 56 years old, married, and has two adult children.  He is from the small village of Gurjaani district. Each member of the family is actively involved in agricultural activities. They have two pigs and a vineyard. They sell piglets seasonally and produce wine. 

As the existing income is not enough for a four-member family, Solomon decided to get a loan. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Solomon applied for a loan from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With a loan of 3,000 GEL, Solomon will be able to purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. With support of the Start Up program, he will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is 24 years old and lives in Gaza. He is married and has four children.

He has owned a barbershop since 2010. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an air conditioner, do small decorations, and buy some  furniture.  

He hopes that this loan will improve his barbershop and thus increase his customers and improves his income.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, do small decorations, and buy some  furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and sheep.

loans.name: 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 23 DE OCTUBRE está en su ciclo 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es aun un grupo nuevo, pero todas ellas se esfuerzan por mejorar sus vidas y la de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, y en la que día a día trabaja, luchando por el sustento de sus seres queridos y también para mejorar su calidad de vida. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que ha podido mejorar mucho y salir adelante.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, comestibles, frutas, verduras y demás, para surtir su despensa y seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The 23 de Octubre [October 23rd] group is in its third cycle in the Women's Program. This is still a new group, but all of the women work hard to improve their and their families' lives.
One of the members is Liliana, who has a well-stocked store in her home. She works there every day, fighting to feed her loved ones and to improve their quality of life. She tells us that she started with very little, but that she has been able to improve quite a bit and get ahead.
She is requesting this support in order to invest in the purchase of drinks, food, fruit, vegetables, and more in order to stock her store and continue to give her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 61-year-old married father of five children.

He has been working in a shoe-making business for 42 years. He is an expert in his business, which is his only source of income. 

Ali is dedicated to his business, but because of his family's increasing needs, he couldn't afford to develop his factory and buy new updated machines.
 
Ali produces shoes that his machines are capable of, and he is proud of his production. He knows his market very well, and works upon request.

Today, he is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy leather to produce a new shoe collection.

He is anxious about this loan, and it will be his fifth cycle loan from Al Majmoua. All of his previous loans were invested in covering his business needs, and he is happy with the outcomes.

loans.use: To buy leather to produce new shoes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is still married to Samuel and their five children are well. Her retail business is still operational and her income from the previous loan also increased to thirty thousand shillings per month.

She has now applied for her ninth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock for her retail shop by adding rice, cooking fat, sugar, and other items to her business. 

In future she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman and also sell good in wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is 29 years old and has five children. Here is what she said when she was interviewed by the loan officer: “Nothing makes me happier than being a fortunate mother of five. I adore my kids and they are my priority. The little one is just 2 months old. The presence of all of my kids makes me unconditionally happy.”

“This will be my first loan and, being a responsible person, I will pay it off. I have been in the animal husbandry for almost ten years now and have been selling raw milk to the nearby dairy farm where they produce mainly cheese. With this loan I will be able to buy some fodder and rebuild the poorly stable that we built previously since we had no money to buy what was necessary,” was Adriana’s last sentence to the loan officer.

loans.use: to rebuild the stable and buy fodder for the animals.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur lives in the town of Kutaisi. He is 61 years old and lives with son, daughter-in-law, and 6-year-old grandson. Temur is an auto-mechanic and works at the nearby village. He gets a small monthly salary as well as his son, who is a distributor at a private company. 

Temur decided to start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Temur will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver during his free time. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 38-year-old married father of two children. He has been working in baking special delightful bread and traditional Manakish and pastries since twenty-two years ago. In 2012 he opened his present bakery and he is working hard to develop it to meet customers needs.

Hassan is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy a new oven that works on burning wood instead of gas, because it produces pastries with a special baked taste and an attractive finishing color too.

Hassan hopes to improve his bakery through the future loan through making necessary maintenance and decoration to please his customers and attract new ones.

loans.use: to buy a new oven necessary for his business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
La señorita Fatima es costurera, se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 4 años, esta profesión le ayudo a cubrir los gastos de su estudio. Ella comenta que el factor económico y tiempo le resultaron muy complicados ya que su trabajo le abarcaba mucho tiempo y le costaba estudiar, pero se mentalizo y haciendo horas extras en su trabajo pudo en sus días libre estudiar.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y  agradece a sus padres el apoyo moral que le brindaron, de aquí a fin de año tiene previsto graduarse y trabajar en su vocación que es la de servir a su comunidad a través de sus servicios como Licenciada en uno de los hospitales de la zona.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, y quiere poder cubrir esos gastos para poder recibir su titulo al terminar la carrera.
texts.en:
Fatima has been a seamstress for over 4 years. This profession has helped her to pay her study costs. She tells us that the factors of economics and time have made things very complicated because her work requires a lot of time and this cuts into her studies. However, she is visualizing her goals and working extra hours so that she can study on her free days.
She is studying nursing, and thanks her parents for their moral support. She plans to graduate and start working as a nurse by the end of the year. Her vocation will be to serve her community as a licensed nurse in one of the local hospitals.
She is requesting this loan in order to invest in her tuition costs. She wants to cover these costs in order to be able to receive her diploma at the end of her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition costs.

loans.name: Rafaella

texts.es:
Rafaela es de la Ciudad de Villarrica, cuenta que sus padres son  separados, tiene tres hermanas. Comenta que su familia es la que la inspira a seguir luchando para mejorar cada día.
Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, y comenta que se está esforzando mucho por crecer y el día de mañana ser una gran profesional, útil, no solo a si misma sino también a los demás.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y también cubrir gastos que surjan. Agradece por esta oportunidad de seguir creciendo y estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Rafaela is from the city of Villarrica. Her parents are divorced and she has three sisters. She tells us that her family is her inspiration to continue fighting to improve day to day.
She is studying commercial engineering and tells us that she is working very hard so that she can soon be a great professional. She wants to be useful, not only to herself but also to others.
She is requesting this loan in order to invest in paying for her classes and to cover other costs that come up. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing and to get closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay for university classes and other costs.

loans.name: Ma Kou

texts.en:
Ma Kou is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is married and has four children aged between 15 and 55; only two are in school, and all four live at home. She describes herself as hardworking.

She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Ma Kou has a table business from which she has sold oil and fufu (cassava dough) for the past 15 years. She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is few goods on her table. She intends to use the loan to buy more oil and fufu (cassava dough) for her business. She started her business with money from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes to one day to build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more oil and fufu (cassava dough) for her business.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 40 years old and a widow. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past 15 years. She wants the loan to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Christina Hakim

texts.en:
Christina is a client of Finance South Sudan Limited. She is 49 years old and married. She has five children, and the three young ones go to school. She is a businesswoman who buys and sells stock like charcoal, ground nuts and some foodstuffs. 

She is a borrowing a loan of 500 Sudanese Pounds to enable her to expand her business and buy stock. The profits she gets from this business will enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family and pay school fees for her children. She also desires to construct a house later on, when her business expands more.

loans.use: to buy stock like charcoal, paste  and ground nuts.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en: Merab is a 52-year-old married man from a small village in Tskaltubo district. His wife Darejan lives abroad. Merab is a very hardworking man and is actively involved in agricultural activities. He has three milking cows, whose milk is used in making cheese products. Merab sells cheese at a good price at local markets. The income is hardly enough to cover everyday costs, so he decided to apply for a loan and start new business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan applications because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Merab applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start-Up Program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, which permits the rural poor to start up or re-start businesses. With a loan of $5,000, Merab will build a greenhouse. As the greenhouse is built, he will be able to sow various kinds of vegetables. With this financial support, Merab will be able generate more income and improve his living conditions, and to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Consessa

texts.en:
Consessa is 53 years old. She sells bananas and has spent 12 years in the business. She is a widow with two children, ages 13 and 17. 

With this loan, Consessa would like to add more bananas for resale. The profits from her business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is a 29-year-old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is very hard-working and is doing his best to improve his living conditions. He went for a bachelor’s degree. He never depends on anyone, always doing as much he can to earn money for his daily expenses. However, he is unable to buy some furniture, because what he earns is hardly enough to pay the household expenses. He decided to apply for a Youth Loan of 150,000 YER to buy some furniture. He hopes that his living conditions will improve, because he wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for his house.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine is 44 years old. She and her family live in Yerevan. Narine is married and has two daughters, both of whom are married and live in Germany. Narine’s husband is a driver with a small salary, and only with the help of Narine’s work are they able, together, to earn their living and sometimes to provide their grandchildren with presents too. For seven years, Narine has worked as a tailor right in her house, where she has all necessary equipment (including a sewing machine, thread, and a special iron) for her work. She sews men’s and women’s trousers and shirts and women’s dresses and blouses. She also sews children’s clothes. Narine says that if weren’t for her grandmother, she would never knew have known all the secrets and details of her work. She says that, for some time, it was a kind of hobby for her to sew for family members, especially for her two pretty daughters, but with the passage of time, it became a business, a way of earning money. Today she has a lot of loyal customers, who rely on Narine's skill and taste and wear dresses made by her with great pleasure. Narine is applying for a loan of 270,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to buy a large quantity of fabric for her sewing activities. She thanks you in advance and eagerly awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fabric for her sewing business, for which she thanks you in advance and eagerly awaits your support.

loans.name: Jonatan

texts.es: Jonatan, a sus 24 años de edad vive con su pareja en unión libre. Es un joven emprendedor, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, pero por falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil encontrar oportunidades de empleo, esto lo ha llevado a vivir una situación económica muy inestable y por eso se motivó para iniciar su propio negocio, una sala de internet y video juegos, adicionalmente tiene máquinas traga monedas y vende gaseosas y mecato para complementar los ingresos,  durante los 2 años que lleva funcionando. Él nunca había tenido experiencia en el manejo de sistemas, pero fue aprendiendo con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, esto le ha permitido obtener ingresos para llevar el alimento diario a su hogar. Solicita el crédito como un apoyo para ir mejorando su negocio, lo desea invertir en la compra de una impresora multifuncional y surtir con mecato y gaseosas, de esta forma amplía el portafolio de servicios que presta y esto le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos para poder ahorrar y cumplir una de sus principales metas que es ver crecer su negocio y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Jonatan, 24 years old, lives with his partner in a common law marriage.  He is a young entrepreneur, with vision and a great desire to get ahead but due to a lack of work experience it has been difficult for him to find employment opportunities.  This has led him to live in a very unstable economic situation and for that reason he was motivated to start his own business, an internet café and video game room.  Additionally he has slot machines and sells soft drinks and snacks to supplement his income during the two years that he has been up and running.  He had never had experience in systems management but he has been learning with a lot of effort and dedication.  This has allowed him to obtain income to bring the daily food to his home.  

He is requesting a loan as a support for improving his business.  He wants to invest it in the purchase of a multifunction printer and to stock up on snacks and soft drinks.  In this way he will expand the portfolio of services that he offers and this will allow him to increase his sales and his income in order to be able to save and achieve one of his principal goals which is to see his business grow and in this way give his wife a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a multifunction printer and to stock up on snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es: Sandra, con 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, cabeza de familia, vive con sus dos hijos de 3 y 13 años. Ha pasado por momentos difíciles debido a que nunca tuvo el apoyo del padre de los niños y, por falta de oportunidades laborales pasó por muchas necesidades; esto la motivó a iniciar su propio negocio y montó una venta de jugos naturales y alimentos fritos (pasteles de pollo, empanadas, papas), actividad que comenzó de una forma empírica y poco a poco fue adquiriendo habilidad para atender bien a sus clientes, es así como obtiene el dinero para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Sandra es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, se esfuerza con esmero para brindarle a sus hijos una estabilidad económica, por eso trabaja largas jornadas, abre su puesto de trabajo desde las 6:00 de la mañana y lo cierra a las 7:00 de la noche. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una greca (cafetera) y surtido (empanadas, pasteles, papa rellena) con el fin de ofrecer más variedad de productos y satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de los clientes que transitan por el lugar, así tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir el sueño de tener un local propio, donde los clientes estén más cómodos, con esto podrá ofrecer una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de todos.
texts.en:
Sandra, 32 years old, is a single mother who lives with her 2 children, aged 3 and 13. She has passed through difficult moments because she never had the help of the father of her children. And due to the lack of work opportunities, she lacked many necessities. This motivated her to initiate her own business. Sandra began selling natural juices and fried foods (several kinds of buns, including chicken, and stuffed potatoes). She began experimentally and, little by little, she acquired the ability to offer good service to her customers. Thus she managed to obtain the money needed for her family's daily support.

Sandra is an enterprising and determined woman who pushes ahead conscientiously to offer her children economic stability. For this reason, she works long days, opening her stall at 6:00 am and closing it at 7:00 at night.

With the loan Sandra requests, she intends to purchase a coffee maker and a selection of stuffed buns, pastries, and stuffed potatoes. She wants to offer a greater variety of products and satisfy the needs and likes of her customers who transit the location. Thus she will have a better opportunity of improving her income and achieving her dream of having her own shop, where customers can be more comfortable. And with this, she will be able to offer a better education to her children and improve the quality of life for all.

loans.use: buy a coffee maker and a selection of stuffed buns, pastries, and stuffed potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 29-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is a single and has four children, between 1 and 15. She describes herself as hard-working. She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. Josephine has had a shop which sells artificial hair for the past two years. She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is too few goods in her shop. She intends to use the loan to buy more artificial hair for her business. She started her business with money from her mother. She likes her business because keeps her busy. She hopes one day to buy a car.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Please meet Hawa from Liberia. She lives and works in Nimba County. Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia, producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area bringing lots of trade.  It is also the second most populous area in Liberia.

Hawa did not attend school and is married.  Her husband is not working now.  Hawa has eight children between the ages of 12 and 24. One of her children is in school and they all live at home.

Hawa has table business where she has sold rice, oil, pepper, etc. for the past five years.  She will use this loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

On average, Hawa works 10 hours at her business. She started her business with money from her friends. She transports her merchandise by bus.  She cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is that she makes more profit.  In the future, she would like to own a house.

She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Holy Heart's Group

texts.en:
The group called “Holy Heart” is in its sixth loan cycle with ID Ghana and has been solid over time. This group was created in May 2011. It is composed of members from the same district.

Solomon is one of the group members. He sells mobile phone credit vouchers and he is a very enterprising man who is focused on customer care, which is why he is doing very well with his business. This phone credit vouchers business is very fast moving and profitable. Solomon says that everything he does is to give his family a good living. He will use this loan to purchase more phone credit vouchers in different denominations so that he can serve all classes of people in the society who are mobile phone users.

The only male in the photo, Solomon is 41 years old, married, and has a 12-year-old daughter. 

The other members of the group sell tomatoes and materials.

loans.use: To purchase more phone credit vouchers in different denominations so that he can serve all classes of people in the society.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Elisabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Elisabeth is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Elisabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Elisabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Manyak

texts.en: Manyak and her family live in the village of Vzashen in the Tavush region. She is married and has three children, a son and two daughters. Her older daughter is married and lives separately with her family. Manyak’s second daughter lives in Yerevan and works at the school as a teacher. Her son is a student in his third year at Yerevan State University, Ijevan Branch, in the history department.  Manyak herself is a teacher. She obtained higher education.  For nearly twenty five years, she has worked at the local school as a teacher of chemistry and biology. Her husband is unemployed and, from time to time, he goes to the Russian Federation in order to earn more money for his family’s living expenses. Manyak is a hardworking woman, and she capably manages beekeeping and agriculture, together her work at the school. She has six beehives, twenty chickens and a lot of fruit trees (apple, peach, pear, plum and grape). She sells her farming (eggs and honey) and agricultural products she at the Ijevan wholesale markets. Nevertheless, she and her husband together barely manage to cover their family needs; the expenditures are high and their problems are increasing, so there is never enough money for agriculture and the farm and their family. Manyak applied for a loan in order to buy several beehives, enlarge her beekeeping activity, and increase her income, with the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy several beehives, enlarge her beekeeping activity, and increase her income with the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Juliet is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves). Juliet can usually be found selling her ‘Wakye’ in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Juliet is married and has five children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

Juliet wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans to increase her current inventory levels. Consequently, this loan will help her prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Wakye.’ In the long term, Juliet plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her business.

loans.name: Kumbah

texts.en: Kumbah is a 34-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is a married and has four children, between 10 and 20, of whom only two are in school and live at home. She describes herself as hardworking. She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire. Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. It also has the second highest population in Liberia. Kumbah has a business selling rice, pepper, oil, Vita (a fruit drink), onions and other items from a table for the past two years. She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is too few goods in her shop. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, pepper, oil, Vita, onions and other items to sell in her business. She started her business with money from her mother. She likes her business because she makes profits. She hopes to build a house one day.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, oil, Vita (a fruit drink), onions and other goods to sell in her business.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 30 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past eight years. Her husband works as a motorcyclist. With this loan, Immaculee wants to buy more bananas and sorghum for resale. The profits from her business will be used to reinvest in the same business

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 41-year-old married man, the father of five children.  Ahmad owns an iron lathe, which is a highly sought-after business in the region. Ahmad is well-known and has a good reputation. One of the services he provides to customers is that he transports the machines they want him to work on to his workshop and back free of charge. This is Ahmad's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good credit history. Through this loan, Ahmad is going to pay his son's engagement expenses as a gift. He hopes to expand his business to keep it capable of covering his family's increasing needs.

loans.use: to pay his for son's engagement expenses as a gift.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en: Ibtissam is a 47-year-old widowed mother of three children. She has worked hard to meet their needs and provide them with the best of living conditions since her husband passed away. In 2008, Ibtissam started her own food preparation and selling business, to make her family's living, after her husband left her and her precious children alone with no fixed income. Ibtissam's business is home-based. She prepares food and sells it in response to her customers’ needs. Today she is working hard on expanding her business, since her children’s needs are increasing. Because she is a Palestinian refugee, the fields in which she can work are limited, which is why she found this business, which is easy to manage at home, where she can take care of both family and business issues. Ibtissam is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy a freezer she needs for her business, to preserve the food she prepares in a fresh healthy way until it is sold. She hopes to expand her business, to make sure her family will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a freezer she needs for her business, to preserve the food she prepares in a healthy way until it is sold.

loans.name: Richal

texts.en:
Please meet 31-year-old Richal from Liberia. She lives and works in Nimba County. Nimba is one of the most resource-rich areas in Liberia producing minerals such as iron ore. The county shares a border with both Cote D’Ivoire and Guinea. As a result, many people on business pass through the area bringing lots of trade. It is also the second-most populous area in Liberia. 

She did not attend school and is married. Her husband is not working now. She has three children between the ages of 12 and 9. They are in school and live at home. 

On average, she works nine hours a day in her business. She started her business with money from her friends. She transports her merchandise by bus. She cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is that makes good profit. In the future, she would like to own a house.
  
Richal has table business where she has been selling rice, oil, pepper etc for the past five years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more rice, oil, pepper etc for her business.  

She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 45 years old. She sells drinks and has been in this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy beers and sodas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a small-scale shoe vendor in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior-high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Belinda has been selling clothing for close to one year. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of shoes, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a shoe stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of shoes.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Janet is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 14 years. 

Janet is married and has five children. Her husband works as a miner. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Janet will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is a 51-year-old woman. She lives with her two sons in the small village of Khoni district. 

Nina is very hard-working woman. She has three milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Nina milks the milking cows everyday and produces cheese to sell in the local markets. Her sons are unemployed. The family lives in poverty and gets a small monthly pension from the government institutions. 

Due to the above-mentioned situation, Nato lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business since they require stable income and business experience. 

The start-up program, created by Kiva and Credo, enabled Nato to get a loan of USD 4,200 to purchase a truck. After the truck is purchased, her sons will go to the local forest and bring wood from the forest, using the truck. They will sell the wood in the village and earn income. The wood is mainly used by the village population to heat the houses and cook in ovens. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to be used for hauling firewood for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Eunice is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for one year. Eunice is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Eunice wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey.’ In the long term, Eunice plans to reinvest her profits back into her business, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Melody decided to set up her own second-hand clothing business in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). With over four years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more used clothing for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a miner) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Flora Ginu

texts.en:
Flora is a Finance Sudan Client. She is 45 years old and married with six children. Some of her children are in primary and others are in secondary schools. She is a businesswoman who sells items like charcoal, bread, groundnuts and eggs; she has been in business for over one year now. 

She is borrowing 500 Sudanese Pounds to buy more stock for her small shop. She intends to use the profits to open a big shop, pay school fees and also feed her family.

loans.use: To buy items like charcoal, bread, groundnuts and eggs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old. She lives in Malindi, Kenya where she runs a small grocery store. She has been doing this for the last three years and she has one employee who helps her in selling. Beatrice is employed and that is why she has employed someone to run her business. She hopes to one day leave employment and concentrate full-time on her business.

Beatrice wants to add more cabbages, fruit, and charcoal for her business. The challenges that she faces include competition and lack of funds. She learned of Milango through her friends who were also members at Milango. Beatrice is married and blessed with one child. She wants to work hard, supplement her husband's income, give their child a better education, and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, fruit, and charcoal

loans.name: Voskan

texts.en:
Voskan lives in the village of Dsegh in the Lori region. He is married and has two children. His son is on military service and his daughter is still school-aged. Voskan's wife is unemployed and together with her husband she is engaged in farming. They have a small, cute farm where they breed a cow, a calf, two piglets, and twenty chickens. In addition to farming, Voskan works at their village forestry as a keeper. Voskan’s wife manages to sell some milk and eggs to villagers and the rest they keep for their own use. With his two jobs Voskan hardly manages to cover his family and farm needs and provide minimum living conditions for his children.

Voskan is thinking of a new business: he wants to sell beef and pork to the Vanadzor butchers. For this he needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy several bulls and start his new business.

loans.use: To buy several bulls and start his new business which will bring him a good profit

loans.name: Dilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Dilma tiene 49 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos, agricultora, ama de casa y comerciante de ropa usada la cual es vendida con los vecinos y amigos que llegan a su casa de habitación lugar donde tiene el negocio, con un grado de educación primario completo. En compañía de su compañero de hogar el cual es maestro de educación tienen un cultivo de café, maíz y frijol el cual es propio y agradecen a DIOS por tener una tierra en la cual puedan cultivar lo propio y obtener las ganancias netas. Sus cultivos están ubicados cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie al salir de sus diferentes actividades.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de maíz y frijoles con los cuales busca obtener una mejor cosecha y asegurar el producto final de plagas y bichos.

Los planes a futuro son los de poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café ya que de esta forma ella podrá obtener mejores ingresos con la agricultura y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y demás necesidades que se presenten en un futuro.
texts.en:
Dilma is forty-nine years old and is the mother of two children.  She is a farmer and housewife, and also sells used clothing to the neighbors and friends that come to her home (where she has her business).  She has completed a primary level of education.  She lives with her partner.  He is a teacher.  Together they have their own coffee, corn, and bean crops.  They are thankful to God that they have land where they can cultivate their own crops and make a clear profit.  Their crops are located close to their home, and they are able to walk to carry out their different business activities.

She has requested financing from the communal bank COMIXMUL.  She will use it to buy agricultural supplies for her corn and bean crops.  With these supplies, she will have a better harvest and can protect her final products from pests and bugs.

Her future plan is to cultivate a better variety of coffee.  In this way, she will be able to make better profits from farming.  She can also continue supporting her children in their studies and with other necessities they may require in the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel es ama de casa y agricultora no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus suegros con 23 años de edad y un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el 4 grado. Ella en compañía de su pareja se dedica a la agricultura especial mente al cultivo de café y el terreno que ella ayuda a cultivar a su pareja es propio. Como todo en la vida hay desafíos que son atraso y representan costos para ellos como el ser: el traslado de los insumos agrícolas  que ayudan a que sus cultivos de café estén protegidos de la roya, plagas y bichos que lo deterioren. Ella tiene una parte de sus cultivos a una distancia de 30 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación y la otra parte en la propiedad sonde está construida la casa.  

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra y traslado de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a mejorar sus cosechas de café y a mantenerlas protegidas. 

Sus planes y metas son mejorar sus cosechas de café tecnificándolas y dando el cuidado y asistencia que necesitan para evitar que sean consumidas por la roya y otros bichos.
texts.en:
María Isabel is a housewife and farmer. She does not have children and she lives with her in-laws. She is 23 years old and has a 4th grade education. Along with her husband, she works in agriculture, especially in coffee cultivation. The land that she helps her husband to cultivate is their own.

Like everything in life, there are challenges that slow production and cost money, like transporting agricultural supplies that help protect her coffee crops against blight, pests, and bugs that damage them. Some of her crops are a 30-minute walk from her home and the other part is on the property where her home is located.

She has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL communal bank to buy and transport agricultural supplies that will help her to improve and protect her coffee crops.

Her plans and goals are to improve her coffee crops by becoming more technical and providing the care and assistance that they need to prevent them from being consumed by blight and other bugs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and transport them to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a small-scale women’s clothing vendor in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate.
