She is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher. Abigail has been selling clothing for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase more women’s clothes, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase women’s clothes

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El Sr. Samuel  tiene 27 años tiene 2 hijos que son gemelas de 4 años,  el señor se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva juvenil en una tienda que se encuentra ubicado en la zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de El  Alto,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia con la institución, el Sr. Samuel  va a utilizar  este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para cambio de stock de la tienda,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por el cambio de temporada comprara nueva mercadería para surtir su tienda y le hace falta efectivo, el Sr. Samuel   enfrenta retos en su negocio los cuales implica la ubicación que es céntrica en pero a su vez peligrosa ya que en inmediaciones de la misma existe mucha competencia y necesita constantemente renovar mercadería, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir la tienda y ahorrar para poder ya que su deseo para su negocio es tener otra tienda y así poder expandirse y crecer con su negocio, además de expandirse en la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Samuel is 27 years old. He has 4-year-old twin sons. He makes a living by selling new children's clothing in a store located in a very busy part of the city of El Alto.

This will be his second loan with this institution. Samuel will use this loan to buy merchandise to re-stock his store. The reason that he requests this loan is that, because of the change of season, he needs to buy new merchandise to re-stock the store and he lacks cash.

Samuel faces challenges in his business, like the location, which is centrally situated but dangerous. There is also a lot of competition nearby and he constantly needs to update his merchandise.

He will use the benefits to purchase more merchandise to stock the store and save money, since his dream for his business is to open another store and expand and grow his business, and also to expand to the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to re-stock his store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: El Sr. Richard  tiene 21 años, el tiene la actividad de transporte de pasajeros en la localidad de el Torno el es moto taxista,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Richard  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una  motocicleta  y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Richard  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando repuestos y si se puede otra motocicleta, El Sr. Richard  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse, el deseo del El Sr. Richard  es tener una tienda donde pueda vender motocicletas.
texts.en:
Richard is 21 years old. He has a business in which he transports passengers in the city of Torno. He has a motorcycle taxi.

This is his second loan with this institution. Richard will use this loan to buy a motorcycle so that he can provide better service to his clients and increase his earnings. He requests this loan so that he can continue improving his business. Richard will use the benefits to continue buying replacement parts and, if he can, another motorcycle.

Richard is a very hard-working person. He is happy to have this opportunity since this is the only business that allows him to support himself. Richard's dream is to have a store where he sells motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sashik

texts.en:
Sashik lives in the village of Vazashen which is in the Tavsuh region. Sashik has a big and nice family. He has three children (who are already married) and six grandchildren. Sashik's youngest son, along with his family, lives with him and helps him a lot in farming and agriculture. 

For many years, Sashik has worked as a locksmith. Now, he works as an electrician. His wife also works as an accountant at the local school. At the same school, their daughter-in-law works as a librarian. 

Despite all the family members having their own jobs, they perfectly manage their farm and agricultural occupations. They have on their farm, three pigs and twenty piglets, twenty chickens, and a cow. Their agricultural occupation is bigger because they have a great amount of land. Most of their time and virtue goes to land cultivation and on maintaining a fruit garden. They cultivate crops, cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, and potatoes. They also have apple, plum, peach, persimmon, and fig trees.  All these goods they manage to sell through re-sellers. 

Sashik asks for a loan because he wants to buy several pigs, a lot of animal fodder, and also several bee hives. It is his first loan with Kiva and he can be guaranteed to be a very responsible client since, five times, he has taken loans from Nor Horizon and he has successfully paid them back.

loans.use: to buy several pigs, a lot of animal fodder, and several bee hives.

loans.name: Great Ladies Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! In this photo is 28-year-old Gret, from Mutare. Gret is a member of the group called Great Ladies. She is married and has two children, only one of whom is attending school.  Gret runs a retail business, selling crating timber. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges faced in her business are high transport costs and, sometimes, they get timber of low quality from their supplier, which will take more time to sell. 

Gret's share of the Great Ladies group loan is $600, which she will use to buy raw timber. She will process the timber and supply her clients. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Gret plans to have her own sawmills.

loans.use: to buy timber, to supply to people who are building their houses, in and around town

loans.name: Jardin Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento JARDIN está  compuesto por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Verónica en la foto la de buzo rosado sosteniendo a una niña tiene 32 años dos hijos, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en la zona del Palmar de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, Sra. Verónica utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, arroz y fideo al por mayor  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, Sra. Verónica va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de insumos,  su deseo de Sra. Verónica es crecer en su negocio, es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jardin consists of nine members, eight women and one man, and its chairperson is Verónica. She can be seen in the photo wearing pink sweatpants and holding a little girl. She is 32 years old and has two children. She works selling food in her food stall located in the Palmar neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz. 

This is her first loan with this communal bank, which Verónica will use to buy inputs for food elaboration, such as potatoes, rice, and noodles in bulk. In this way she hopes to improve her sales and increase her working capital. The reason why she requests this loan is that she does not have the capital for buying inputs. Verónica will use this benefit to continue buying inputs in bulk. Her wish is for her business to grow, she is a hard-working person who is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it offers her by giving her this loan.

loans.use: to buy inputs for food elaboration

loans.name: Maria Sandra

texts.es:
María Sandra es una mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos los cuales estudian en secundaria en diferentes grados de educación, comerciante y agricultora desde muy temprana edad ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Tiene 6 años de educación primaria y en compañía de su esposo se dedican a la agricultura al cultivo siembra y vivero de café. El terreno que ella tiene es propio gracias al esfuerzo puesto por ella y su esposo el cual está ubicado a una distancia de 15 kilómetros al cual se trasladan en vehículo. Uno de su mayor desafío es la distancia al cual está ubicado su terreno ya que tienen que pagar una asistencia temporal para colecta, limpia y recolección de café cuando ellos no pueden hacerlo a parte el incremento del combustible y el precio de compra de los insumos agrícolas.

Por esa razón ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual ella podrá fortalecer sus cultivos ya que mejorara sus cultivos y los mantendrá protegidos de las plagas y otros bichos.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar sus cultivos implementando una mejor variedad de café hacerla competitiva y atractiva. Sus sueños son educar a sus hijos verlos convertidos en profesionales con carreras que ayuden al desarrollo de sus vidas, su familia y demás.
texts.en:
María Sandra is 37 years old, married and has two children in different grades of secondary school.  She has been a merchant and farmer since she was very young since her parents taught her how to work on the land from a very young age.  María Sandra has a sixth grade education and she and her husband both work planting, growing and caring for the coffee crop.  They own the land, which they acquired through hard work, and must travel 15 kilometers by vehicle to get there.  One of their greatest challenges is how far away the land is because they must hire temporary help for harvest, cleaning and collection of the coffee when they cannot do it.  Also, fuell prices have increased as have prices of farm supplies.

Therefore, María Sandra is requesting a loan through COMIXMUL so she can strengthen and improve her crops by protecting them from plant disease and insects.

Her plans for the future include crop improvement by using a better variety of coffee in order to make it more attractive and competitive.  Her goal is to educate her children so they can get professional careers that will help develop their lives, family and other areas.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jose Neptael

texts.es: José, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, y vive con su madre en el municipio de Sulaco, Yoro. José ha establecido su propio negocio en su casa, de venta de repuestos para motocicletas y reparación de la misma. El negocio lleva 4 años de estar funcionando y ha logrado establecer su clientela en su comunidad. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo  por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para surtir el negocio de repuestos de motocicletas para vender (llantas, neumáticos, balinera, hules, empaques, parches, focos, vías, bujías, stop, cadenas, etc.) Y a la vez para brindar el servicio de reparación. El objetivo de incrementar el inventario es para incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es fortalecer el negocio de motocicletas y el negocio de ganado para ayudar económicamente a su familia y continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old, single and lives with his mother in the town of Sulaco in Yoro.  He established his own business at home where he sells motorcycle spare parts and repairs motorcycles.  He has been in business for four years and has managed to establish his clientele in the community.

José is requesting his second loan, in the amount of 20,000 HNL, to stock his business with motorcycle parts (tires, ball bearings, rubber accessories, seals, patches, headlights, spark plugs, tail lights, chains, etc.).  It will also help with his repair service.  

His goal is to increase his inventory in order to increase sales and income.  He wants to strengthen his motorcycle business, and his livestock business, to help his family economically and continue his education.

loans.use: To buy spare parts such as tires, rubber accessories, ball bearings, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr:
Mr LASSINE est né en 1975 à Bamako et vie à Kadiolo au quartier Noumousso dans une famille nucléaire avec sa femme et ses enfants (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il mène des activités d’achat et de ventes de céréales depuis plus de 10 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit beaucoup de commandes de divers clients. Afin d’avoir des ressources nécessaires pour  satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son 9eme prêt et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat d’environ 50 sacs de 50 kg de céréales tels que (mil, maïs, sorgho et fonio). Il s’approvisionne à Kadiolo ainsi que dans les village environnants tel, que Zégoua. Les ventes sont faites à Kadiolo. Les céréales achetées sont stockées dans son magasin à Kadiolo pendant une bonne période.  Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes du village. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de faire face au remboursement des échéances de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste afin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients qui ne cessent de croître
texts.en:
Mr Lassine was born in 1975 in Bamako. He lives in a nuclear family with his wife and children in Noumousso, a neighborhood in Kadiolo (third administrative region of Mali).

He's been buying and selling cereals for more than ten years. His experience in this field earned him a good reputation, and he receives lots of orders from various customers. 

In order to have the resources required to satisfy his customers, he works with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is seeking his ninth loan. All previous loans were repaid without problems.

This new loan will enable him to buy approximately 50 sacks of cereals  (50 kg each) such as millet, corn, sorghum, and fonio. He gest his supplies in Kadiolo, as well as in the surrounding villages, such as Zégoua.

He sells in Kadiolo. Cereals are stocked in his store in Kadiolo for a good amount of time. His clientele is made up of men and women from the village.

Thanks to this loan, he foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 300), which will enable him to repay the loan. The remainder will be reinvested in his business.

He intends to become a wholesaler in order to meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Ana Delicia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Divino Niño de Tohalla se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 61 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 14 hijos, pero cuatro de ellos fallecieron, los 10 que aun tiene ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es agricultor. 

Doña Ana con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual por temporadas mete de cien a doscientos pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, luego de esto los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o sale a entregar en la ciudad con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos. Gracias a esto ellos salen adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas del campo.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta porque le han ayudado mucho con los créditos.

Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The Divino Niño de Tohalla communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton.  The place is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are renowned on a national and international level.  This place is known for the famous straw hats.

Ana, age 61, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law marriage.  She had 14 children, but four of them died.  The ten that she still has are now adults.  Two of them still live in her house.  Her husband is a farmer.

With the intention of earning something on her own, Ana raises poultry.  She has a small farm.  Seasonally she has between 100 and 200 chickens.  She raises them for two to three months, which is the time for them to be ready for sale.  She then sells them to merchants who come to her house, or she goes to the city to sell them with the help of one of her children.  Thanks to this, they get ahead because her husband does not earn much with his field work.

This loan is to buy feed and medicine for the chickens.  She has been in the communal bank since it started.  She is very happy because they have helped her a lot with the loans.  Her dream is for her and her loved ones to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the chickens.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 52-year-old married man from the Tkibuli district of West Georgia. He lives with his 16-year-old son, who goes to the local school. George has chronic health problems and gets a small assistance (approximately 40 USD) from the local government institutions. George’s wife lives and works in Greece and helps the family financially.

As his existing income is not enough to make ends meet for the family, George decided to start a trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. George’s credit requests were rejected several times, as he doesn’t satisfy their requirements.

George received credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This Startup Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. The loan of 3,000 USD will help George purchase starting stock of fruits and vegetables. He will set up a small store and renew his stock from the local distributors. George thinks that the business will be profitable, as the store where he plans to start trading has a great location and is crowded with people. After the business is started, the family will have a stable income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need. George is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his son receives a good education for progressing in life.

loans.use: to start trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Vilma Aracelia

texts.es: Vilma, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio Choloma. Inicialmente vendía accesorios para celulares, plásticos y achinería. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas como ser bananos, piña, mangos y verduras, aguacate, tomates etc. el negocio está ubicado en la orilla de la calle del mismo municipio. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de dos años. El préstamo que solicito es por 5, 000 lempiras, con  el cual comprar al contado consiguiendo mejores precios. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio  y terminar de darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vilma, 38, is a single mother of three children and lives in the town of Choloma.  She started out selling cell phone accessories, plastic products and trinkets but now sells fruit such as bananas, pineapple, mangos, avocado, tomatoes and other vegetables.  Her stand is located along the town's main street and she has been in business for over two years.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 5,000 HNL and it will be used to buy fruit, in cash, in order to get better prices.  Her goal is to expand her business and finish giving her children an education.

loans.use: To stock her business with fresh fruit.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa está casada con Emiliano tienen con 4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos están en la Argentina trabajando y los restantes aun son menores que son el motivo de su lucha de todos los días, procurando poder darles lo mejor.
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en el barrio. Una de sus hija mayor tiene 16 años y le ayuda en con las tareas en la despensa.
Consiguió montar su despensa con un poco de dinero que le había juntado con el trabajo que realiza su marido, quien trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada para que de esa manera pueda ayudar a ella con los gastos del hogar. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en ese barrio.
Teresa solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de comestibles, bebidas, leches y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en:
Teresa is married to Emiliano, and they have 4 children.  Two of their children are working in Argentina.  The other two children are still minors, and they are Teresa's motivation to strive each day in order to provide for them as best she can. 

Teresa has a store that is well-stocked and well-known in the neighborhood.  Her older daughter is 16 years old, and she helps her with the store.  Teresa managed to start up her business with a small amount of money that she had saved from work that she did with her husband.  He works as an employee for a private company so that he can help her with the household expenses.  Teresa is a very tenacious and honest person who is well-known and well-liked by everyone who lives in this neighborhood.

Teresa is requesting a loan to invest in food products, drinks, milk, and other supplies so that she can keep on working and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks, milk, and other products

loans.name: Sidi

texts.fr:
Mr SIDI est né en  1979 à Lofigué, cercle de Kadiolo, Région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Il vie dans une famille monogame à Kadiolo dans le quartier Noumousso. 
Il mène des activités d’achat et de vente de carburant et lubrifiants depuis plus de 5 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son 3eme prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de faire d’acheter 400 litres d’essence. Il s’approvisionne à Kadiolo et à Zégoua 10 jours. Les ventes sont faites à Kadiolo et à Siama.   Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de faire face au remboursement des échéances de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste de bonne renommée à fin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients qui ne cessent de croître
texts.en:
Mr Sidi was born in 1979 in Lofigué, Kadiolo Cercle, Sikasso Region (third administrative region of the republic of Mali). He lives in a monogamous family in Noumousso, a neighborhood in Kadiolo.

He's been buying and selling gasoline and lubricants from more than five years. His experience in this field earned him a good reputation and he gets orders from various customers.

In order to have the resources required to satisfy his customers, he works with Kiva's parter, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is seeking his third personal loan. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

This new loan will enable him to buy 400 liters of gasoline. He gets his supplies in Kadiolo and in Zégoua, and resells in Kadiolo and in Siama. His clientele comprises both men and women.

Thanks to this loan, he foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 75'000 (ca US$ 150). This will enable him to repay his loan. The remainder will be reinvested in his business.

He intends to become a well-known wholesaler in order to meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

loans.use: to buy gasoline

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is a 38-year-old man living in the small village of Vachnadziani with his wife, his retired mother, and an infant daughter. His wife stays home, taking care of her family.

Nodar is involved in a fruit selling business. His district is famous for high-quality grapes and peaches. Nodar buys the fruit in his district at wholesale prices and sells them in the capital city open market. His income is seasonal and the family needs more stable revenue, so Nodar decided to start a new business. As he lacks experience with the new business and does not qualify under income requirements, local credit providers rejected his loan request. He was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides start-up and re-start-up credits with reduced requirements for the rural poor who do not have access to many credit products; they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the amount he is asking for, Nodar will start a second-hand car parts store in his district and purchase merchandise for resale. He will offer the local drivers a wide assortment of products and work till late evening to sell many items. Nodar is a very hardworking and the type of person who puts family first. This credit will be a great support for the family. Nodar is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start up a second-hand spare parts store.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero con tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma. El se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, agua, refrescos y otra Golosinas. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad donde obtiene ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. El préstamo que Roberto solicito es por L.5, 000, el cual los usara para surtir el negocio con la compra de frutas, refrescos, agua y golosinas. Esta inversión le ayudara a comprar al por mayor y conseguir buenos precios en el mercado. Su plan es crecer con el negocio para cambiar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto, 49, is single, has three children and lives in the town of Choloma.  He sells seasonal fruit, water, soft drinks and sweets and has been in business for 15 years, earning a living to support his family.

The loan requested by Roberto, in the amount of 5,000 HNL, will be used to stock his business with fruit, soft drinks, water and sweets.  This investment will help him get better prices at the market and allow him to buy wholesale.  His plan is to expand his business and change his lifestyle.

loans.use: To stock his business with fruit, water, soft drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, foliar insecticides,  and coffee-growing formula for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Lilian

texts.es:
Doña María con 40 años de edad es una mujer luchadora, con muchos sueños, muchas esperanzas para con su hijo y sus cultivos de agricultura los cuales son maíz y frijol. Ella en compañía de su compañero de hogar y su hijo se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo de maíz, frijol y café. Dicha actividad la practican con su pareja hace muchos años pero fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación ya que sus padres en su juventud no pudieron apoyarla por la falta de dinero.

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un apoyo económico a COMIXMUL para la compra de abono entre otros, hacer un nuevo vivero de café y preparar la tierra para cultivarlo.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar su casa de habitación ya que necesita algunas mejoras en cuanto al repello y el piso como también los de poder cultivar una mejor variedad de café la cual pueda ser competitiva en el mercado. Sus sueños es poder darle a su hijo un buen futuro fortalecer el patrimonio que hoy en día con su apoyo están formando en compañía de su compañero de hogar y que él pueda enfrentar la vida de manera favorable.
texts.en:
María, 40, is a hard-working woman who has many dreams and hopes for her son.  She is a farmer and works with her common-law husband and son growing corn, beans and coffee.  She has been in business for many years, having learned farming from her parents when she was very young.  She was unable to get an education because her parents could not pay for it.

María is requesting a loan through COMIXMUL to buy fertilizers, prepare the crop land and set up a new coffee greenhouse.  

Her future plans include renovating her house which needs new plaster on the walls and a new floor.  She also wants to change the variety of coffee she is growing to make it more competitive at the market.  Her goal is to give her son a better future by strengthening the business she has today together with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, prepare her crop land and set up a coffee greenhouse.

loans.name: Mujeres Talentosas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Talentosas está en su ciclo número 15 del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas se encuentran por debajo de la línea, es decir con ingresos muy escasos, pero son conscientes de que deben seguir trabajando para mejorar sus vidas.
Juana, una de ellas, trabaja en la venta de mandioca cocinada y verduras  también se debe destacar el trabajo que hace para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Es una mujer muy trabajadoras, que lucha por su familia y que quiere salir adelante por ellos.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, mandioca, frutas y otros  para poder vender y generar más ingresos el cual la ayudara a mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mujeres Talentosas (Talented Women) is in its 15th loan cycle with the program. The women are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which all of them appear below the poverty line. This means that their incomes are very low, but they are aware that they must keep working to improve their lives.

Juana, one of the members, sells cooked cassava and vegetables, and she strives to provide her family with what it needs. She works very hard for her family and wants to succeed for them. She has applied for a loan to buy vegetables, cassava, fruits, and more to sell and generate more income, which will help her raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, cassava, fruits, and more to sell.

loans.name: Serop

texts.en:
Serop, 32 years of age, lives at the city of Sevan, which is in Gegharkunik region. Serop lives with his wife, son, and retired mother. His father has died several years ago. Serop’s wife works as a hairdresser. Serop's specialty is music. He is a soloist, but unfortunately, he has worked in this profession a very short period of time. Now he owns a private business, a beauty salon for both men and women. He, himself, has become a perfect hairdresser. Serop has three employees and a lot of loyal customers, at his salon.

Serop asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams. He will use it to do some reconstruction work in the salon, to renew the interior. This renovation will entice new customers, and Serop will have more income.

loans.use: to do some reconstruction work in the salon, to renew the interior and attract more customers

loans.name: Nyakatokye Tukore Group

texts.en:
The Nyakatookye group is found in the outskirts of Ibanda town. This group is composed of several petty traders, farmers and hawkers with common problems. The group has a well-organized executive who ensures that their objectives are achieved.

Jane is a member of the group and its secretary; she joined the group after the death of her husband, who left her with three children. From her retail shop, Jane has been able to raise her three children, who are now in school. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) through the group to buy more stock of products of daily household use items like soap, salt, and sugar to boost her shop so that she can effectively pay her childrens' tuition and meet her day-to-day needs. Jane has a dream of finishing up her house, which her husband left incomplete. She hopes to do so when she gets a subsequent loan.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado MUJERES UNIDAS está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comités, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, luchando por ir mejorando y creciendo.
Maris,  a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo y las aplicaciones de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas que ella misma hace, y con la cual deleita a sus  clientes, está luchando por  su familia, para darles todo lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe ella y sus compañeras para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas (Women United) is in its sixth loan cycle with the program. The members are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which two of the women are below the poverty line, and are striving to improve and grow. 

Maris, through hard work and success strategies, is improving her living conditions. She prepares and sells fast food, which her customers love, and she is striving to give her family what it needs. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies such as meats, vegetables, and condiments to continue making her foods. She is grateful for the chance she and her partners have received to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está  haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como un medio para conocer la situación de las señoras integrantes, donde 9 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos mensuales muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eulalia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Ella venta de ropas y calzados y de esa forma está tratando de salir adelante, también se debe destacar el esfuerzo que hace por ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia, por medio de las capacitaciones y demás actividades que hacen juntas.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos como ropas, zapatos, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kuña Guapa is participating in the poverty reduction survey to determine each member's situation. Nine of the women are living below the poverty line, which means they earn very little each month. 

Eulalia, one of the members, was living at level one in the last survey. She sells clothing and shoes to get ahead. She works hard to improve her and her family's lives through training and other group activities. She has applied for a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing and footwear, which will help her firm up her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Las Guapas Group

texts.es:
Las guapas es un grupo de la ciudad de Caaguazú, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una, son 5 las señoras con ingresos inferiores que luchan y trabajan por mejorar.
María es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de Elementos de limpieza y, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de elementos de limpieza para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Las Guapas” is a group in the city of Caaguazú.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey as a way of getting to know each one of their situations.  Five of the women are low-income and they strive and work to improve.

María is one of the members and she works selling cleaning supplies.  The work of the advisors who carry out permanent training follow-up and verifications which simultaneously require and encourage the women to strive to overcome poverty must also be emphasized.

María is requesting this loan to buy cleaning supplies to sell which will help her realize her business plan which in turn will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies to sell.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
When Dominic got his first Kiva loan, he was able to add to his working capital for his Zoona mobile money transfer business. Dominic's business deals in processing mobile money transfers, and in addition he sells groceries. He used the profits from his Zoona mobile money transfers business, to purchase a new fridge for his perishable groceries and beverages. He is very thankful for the previous loan, because it has helped his business improve. 

Seeing how his business has improved has encouraged Dominic to get another Kiva loan. This new loan will enable him to serve even more customers who want to send and receive money from his shop. Dominic is hopeful that this second loan will help him earn enough profits so that he can open a second mobile money transfer outlet, in the future. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona money transfer business by adding to his working capital, which will allow him to serve more customers who want to send and receive money at his shop

loans.name: Abekundire Women's Group

texts.en:
Abekundire Women's Group is a group of men and women, living within Ibanda town council, mainly traders, farmers and several other occupations. 

Charity, now 45 years old, is a widow member of the group who operates a small retail shop and raises poultry for supplementary income. She has responsibility for taking care of six children, whom her late husband left behind. Despite being a single mother, Charity has been able to cope with life and can now ably look after her family with ease. 

Charity's main challenge is that she wants to construct a permanent poultry house in order to protect her birds from theft and bad weather. She has, therefore, applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to assist her in buying construction materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials for a poultry house.

loans.name: Santa Monica Group

texts.es:
“Santa Monica” está en su Primer Ciclo, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, ir mejorando sus vidas y las de su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que tienen ingresos poco seguro.
Sulma, una de las integrantes, tiene un salón de Belleza también se debe destacar el trabajo  que ella hace, ya que trabaja todos los días, tratando de mejorar los servicios que da a sus clientes, también de tener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia, quienes son su inspiración.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de todo tipo de limas, pinceles, pestañas y pegamentos, hilo decorativo, Algodón, etc  , lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Santa Mónica” is in its first cycle.  They all work and help each other out in order to get ahead and gradually improve their and their families’ lives.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and three of the women are below the poverty line, that is to say their source of income is not very secure.

Sulma is one of the members.  She has a beauty salon and the work she does should be pointed out because she works every day trying to improve the service she provides her customers and also to earn higher income to help her family who are her inspiration.

She’s requesting this loan to buy all types of emery boards, brushes, eyelashes and glue, decorative thread, cotton, etc. which will help her realize her business plan which in turn will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Medalla Milagrosa hace 13 ciclos que trabajan dentro del programa, y están luchando por cada día ir mejorando sus vidas y las de su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como medio de conocer como se encuentran ellas y para ayudarse y de esa forma crecer.
Victoria  es parte de este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora que da  todo de si para ayudar a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de calzados, también se debe destacar que ella es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer y salir adelante.
Hoy ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de más variedad de calzados, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) has been working in the program for 13 cycles and they are striving daily to improve their and their families’ lives.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to get to know how each one is and to help each other out and to grow this way.

Victoria is part of this group.  She’s a very hardworking woman who gives her all to help her family.  She works selling shoes and it should be stressed that she’s a person who very much wants to grow and get ahead.

The loan she requests today is to buy more variety of shoes which will help her realize her business plan and in turn improve her income.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: Harutyun, who lives in Lchashen village in Gegharkunik region, again wants to have a deal with Kiva lenders. He is sure that the deal will be as productive as the previous one. The last one helped him in the purchase of animal fodder and potato seedlings. This new one, he needs in order to buy several cows and animal fodder, because he plans to enlarge his farm. In farming, Harutyun’s wife helps him very much. Their daughters have grown up, and they, also, have become perfect helpers for their father in farming and agriculture. All of them, together, breed cows, sheep and chickens, and cultivate potatoes. They are happy to work hard and have a result -- good income and better living conditions for their family.

loans.use: to buy several cows and animal fodder, so he can enlarge his family's farm

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in alpaca accessories like ponchos and sweaters, as well as throws. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of alpaca to increase production.

Nestor has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"I hail from Peru's Puno region, renowned for quality alpaca and sheep wool. I have been dedicated to the textile arts for more than 25 years; it has been a family trade for generations. When I first began to weave, I worked on the rustic looms that I built along with other family members. Together we sold our wares at local markets until we were able to acquire modern machinery, which in turn has allowed us to develop newer designs.

"Thank you all for participating in this microcredit. It is a great support for artisans like me, because it enables me to invest in the materials I need to increase my stock. It also makes it possible for me to develop my new designs which I hope you'll like. On behalf of many Andean families, including mine, I would like to send greetings filled with the same warmth of our alpaca wool, as well as our eternal gratitude! Many thanks, and best wishes for joy and prosperity!"

Use this link to view Nestor's alpaca accessories and throws on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3463.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of alpaca wool to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onions, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Rincon De La Experanza Group

texts.es:
Rincon de la Esperanza está en su ciclo número 21 del programa de comité, es un grupo muy trabajador y eso se ve por la cantidad de ciclos que todas llevan trabajando juntas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
 A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo Gilda con el arduo trabajo de costura se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente todas  están conscientes de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus materiales para seguir haciendo sus confecciones, como ser telas, hilos, botones y demás,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Rincón de la Esperanza” (Corner of Hope) is in cycle number 21 in the committee program.  It’s a hardworking group and that can be seen in the number of cycles they’ve all been working together in.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey in order to determine each one of their situations.

By means of effort and continuous work, Gilda is improving her poverty situation by means of the hard work she does sewing.  But just the same they are all aware that work and effort must be continuous and permanent in order to reach total success.

She’s requesting this loan to buy supplies like fabric, threat, buttons, etc. to continue making her creations.  This will help her realize her business plan which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha live in the Paynesville North area, which has a large local market in Montsorrade. She is single and has six children between 3 and 23 years old; three are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. 

For the past three years, Oretha has been selling fish in the community market. She started this business with money given to her by her friends. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She sells six days a week, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She gets her goods to her business by the means of a shared taxi.

Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business,

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Together As One group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL each to invest in their respective businesses. 

Isata is the featured leader of this group. Isata is 34 years old, and is married with three children; two are in primary school and the other is not of school-going age. Isata sells fish and has been in this business for ten years now. With the help of this loan, Isata will invest in her business by buying a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora esta empezando a trabajar juntos y se están ayudando por ir mejorando sus vidas por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y es por medio de esto que saben que 3 de las señoras están con ingresos muy bajos. Pero que aun luchan por ir creciendo.
Tomasa es parte de este grupo, es una mujer luchadora que da todo de si para poder ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Ella se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una pequeña despensa donde todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas. Comenta que su meta es poder dar a los suyos lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de comestibles, bebidas, verduras, frutas y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas, tener mayores ingresos y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
“María Auxiliadora” is starting to work together and help each other out in order to improve their lives by means of group efforts.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and have learned by this means that three of the women are very low-income but even so strive to grow.

Tomasa is part of this group.  She’s a hardworking woman who gives her all to improve her and her family’s life.  She works in sales since she has a small store she works in every day starting at very early hours.  She comments that her goal is to be able to give her loved ones everything they need so that they won’t have to go through any unmet needs.

She requests this loan to buy food items, beverages, vegetables, fruit and other supplies to continue with her sales, to earn higher income and to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
This group of clients from south Iraq requested to remain anonymous on Kiva. 

One of the group members is a 47-year-old woman who is marrried and has five children. With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has ten years of experience with her home based sewing business activity and to improve the services she can offer her customers as well as improve her work conditions she would like to buy an air-conditioning unit to try to make working during the extremely hot summer days a bit more bearable, and good quality raw materials to work with. To be able to make this purchase she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers 'group loans' for clients unable to provide a guarantor, and therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an air-conditioning unit and good quality raw materials to work with.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is a young man, age 22. He is working in a money exchange shop and lives in a humble house in Jabalia. He is engaged and is preparing to get married soon after finishing the house. He is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing new furniture in his house, in order to improve the living conditions. Taking this loan will enable Mousa to complete his house and prepare him well to get married soon. Mousa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his new house and prepare him well to get married soon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and eggs.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 53-year-old Palestinian woman. She is married and living in Jabalia with her husband in a humble house. She is an employee in UNRWA with a small salary that is not enough to cover expenses. 

In the past five years, Jamila’s husband has been driving a bus, which been a profitable project. Jamila is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of repairing and painting the bus he drives. This will improve the bus's condition and enable Jamila’s husband to take additional internal and external requests and transfer his customers, which will improve the family's income positively.  

Jamila is conservative, so her husband is photographed in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of repairing and painting the bus.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in the Paynesville North area which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. Esther and her fiancé live together, and her fiancé works with a clinic. They have three children ages 9 to 14 who are in school and live at home. Esther describes herself as a hard-working woman. Since 2010, she has been selling salt, vita, pepper,  okra, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She sells six days a week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancé. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot. Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, vita, pepper, okra, etc. for her business. She would like to buy a piece of land and build a house. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more  salt, vita, pepper,  okra, etc. for her business

loans.name: Abdel Kareem

texts.en:
Abdel Kareem is a 19-year-old single man. He is living in Jabalia with his family in a very humble house. Abdel Kareem is a dreaming young man who studied the project of having a rickshaw and working on it. He found that this project will be profitable and will improve his income and his living conditions.

Abdel Kareem is requesting a Murabha loan from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing a new rickshaw to transfer goods for the traders in the city. This will affect the Abdel Kareem's income positively. Abdel Kareem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw to transfer goods for the traders in the city.

loans.name: Maa Baishnav Devi Group

texts.en:
Maa Baishnav Devi Joint Liability Group was formed in the year 2010. This group is located in the village Kortipadar of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood of most of the families of this village.  This group consists of five members from below poverty line category and Jashobant (P) is one of them. The lady standing in the middle of the photo with raised hand is Jashobant (P). She is 43 years and has a six-member family with her husband and four daughters aged 15, 12, 10 and 4 years. Three of her daughters are continuing their studies. 

Jashobant (P)  has a vegetable cultivation farm of one hectare, being managed by her husband in the same village with irrigation facilities. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrot, cabbage, chili, cucumber, papayas, ladies fingers, etc. in the farm. She herself takes the vegetable products of her farm to the daily market at the nearest town for selling. She earns a minimum of 400 INR per day but according to her this is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. 

Jashobant (P)  wants to expand her business by taking a fresh loan. This is the 3rd loan for her and she will utilize the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Jashobant (P)  dreams of constructing a house and of better education for her daughters. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

The other four members of this group are Jashobant (D) with a bicycle mart, Kuntala & Bimle with vegetable vending businesses and Sadamani with a general store.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Maa Bamleswari Group

texts.en:
Runa, aged about 33 years, resides with her husband, three daughters and two sons at Muniguda, in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing on the left with her hand raised in the photograph is Runa. 

Runa’s husband has been running a welding shop for the last ten years.He takes order from the customers for  making of iron door, window, grill, gate etc. He earns about 8,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from the business. According to Runa, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures as well as business expenses. So, she wants to expand the business to earn some extra income.

She has already availed three loans from Mahashakti. This is her fourth-cycle loan. With the present loan, she wants to invest in a drilling machine. She has an ambition to give her children higher education for a bright future.

Another member of the group, Mrs. Santoshi, wants a loan for a dry food shop.

loans.use: to purchase a drilling machine for welding work.

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en:
Shahid is a 40-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running an enterprise in his nearby town, since 2003. He has been recruiting workers for embroidery work on daily wages; he also brings some material home for his wife because his wife helps him in embroidery work. He is an expert in his profession. He is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like him for his art and appreciate his efforts. 

Now, the marriage season is going to start with a lot of demand for his art. He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses, so that is why he wants to buy a stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance.

Shahid requires some capital to buy the desired inventory, but he has already been investing all of his savings in his current business. Because of that, he made a humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan of Rs. 150,000. Through this loan, he would be able to buy a stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Now, Shahid is tension free about his inventory and can fully concentrate on his work.

Shahid is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery.

loans.name: Manikeswari Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four women from the village Gadramunda of Nuapada district of Odisha, India united together and formed a Joint Liability Group named “Manikeswari". They formed the group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the further development of their existing business. All of them hail from poor backgrounds. Hemanti is the one who is standing second from the right in the photo with a raised hand. She is 47 years old and resides with her husband and a son of twenty-five years. 

Hemanti has a vegetable cultivation farm in her village, with a water pump and a traditional water-lifting facility from the dug well. She and her husband look after the farm. They produce vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers, papayas, ladies finger (okra), popcorn, etc. on the farm. Traders come to her farm for buying the produce. Apart from this, her son has an air compressor and vehicle tyre-repairing center in the nearby town. 

Hemanti earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from the above businesses. For future development of her family, Hemanti wants to expand her business by taking a fresh loan. This is the second loan for her, and she has planned to utilize a part of the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides for her farm, and another part of the loan for purchasing accessories for her son’s repairing center. She expects a good return from this investment. Hemanti dreams to construct a house and for her son to get married.

The other three members of this group are Nirupama, with a milk business, Dashami, with an electrical center, and Prafulla, with a vegetable cultivation and vending business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm inputs like seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Young Sister's Traders Association Group

texts.en: Isha is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 40-year-old Isha is married to a businessman and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. For four years now, she has been selling ready-to-wear clothing. Isha and her group members are requesting a loan of SLL 2,500,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isha will use her share of the loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Muyoyia Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Muyoyia” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting for a loan of SLL 2,500,000 in order to add inventory into their respective businesses.

The featured leader of this group is Mamusu.  Mamusu is 28; she was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing with her husband and child. Her husband is a businessman, and her child is attending primary school. Mamusu sells clothes. She has requested this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram lives in the village of Aygehovit, which is in Tavush region. He is married and he lives with his parents and his wife, who takes care of their small daughter. 

Aram’s father is a director of a school in the nearby village of Vazashen. At the same school, Aram works as a military teacher. His mother also works as a teacher, but in their local school. Simultaneously they are all engaged in land cultivation. They cultivate beans, tomatoes, and cucumbers. They also have a nice and rich fruit garden with apple, plum, pear, and apricot trees. Aram says that it is a good business and he has a decent income from it.

Aram requests a loan, as he wants to do some construction work and to fence his fruit garden. Nor Horizon has already given him two loans and this time Aram wants to cooperate with Kiva lenders. He hopes very much that in his Autumn harvesting activities, he will have good income and make new plans for further deals with Kiva.

loans.use: To do some construction work and to fence his fruit garden.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie has been running a table business where she sells palm oil. She started this business with help from her father, and she learned how to run the business from her friends. Presently, the problem she has is that she has insufficient commodities to satisfy the demands of her increasing customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil for business. She enjoys her business because a keep her busy and gives her money for others expenses. She is a 7th grade student and single. Her dream is to one day move from the table business to a shop business. She appreciates BRAC's supports.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 30 years old and lives at Paynesville North, which has the largest local  market in Montsorrade. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have two children, ages 6 and 15, who are in school and live at home. She describes herself as one who is family oriented. For the past nine months, Josephine has been selling used clothes in the community market. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She sells every day from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. She started this business with a loan from her husband. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She wants to buy a piece of land and build a house. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es: Dina es una mujer de 28 años de edad, madre de una hija de 5 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde su madre le enseño las labores agropecuarias y la cría y cuidado de los animales, gracias a esto Dina ha podido generar ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, pues ella actualmente cría y engorda cerdos para luego venderlos. La titular es una mujer muy perseverante y se esfuerza día a día para brindarle bienestar a su pequeña hija, quien la motiva para seguir siempre adelante; es por eso que Dina se decide a solicitar su primer crédito, pues desea comprar más cerdos para criarlos y engordarlos y obtener ingresos con la venta de los animales. Esto le ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan por la inestabilidad económica y, así podrá brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Dina’s a 28-year-old mother of a five-year-old daughter; she lives in a common law relationship with her spouse.  She’s spent her entire life in the countryside where her mother taught her agricultural work and how to raise animals.  

Thanks to this Dina has been able to generate her own income to provide daily sustenance at home since she currently raises and fattens up pigs for subsequent sale.  She is a very tenacious woman who strives daily to provide well-being for her little girl who motivates her to continue forward always.  

This is why Dina has decided to request her first loan because she wants to buy more pigs to raise and fatten up and to earn income from the sale of the animals.  This will help her improve her living conditions and overcome obstacles that come up because of economic instability so she can provide her family with better quality of life and her daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and fatten up.

loans.name: Nueva Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Unión está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, hacen actividades para fomentar su compañerismo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde ellas ven esto como una oportunidad de crecimiento y para ayudar a su familia.
Marta es parte de este grupo. Ella tiene una Fruteria donde vende frutas y verduras en general. Lo que hay que destacar son las ganas que tiene ella de poder ir creciendo y mejorando su vida y la de su familia todos los días. Se esfuerza también por poder dar a sus clientes todo lo que piden y así ir creciendo.
La Sra. Marta Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras en general para surtir mas su frutería, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Nueva Unión” (New Union) is in cycle one in the committee program; they are learning to work together and carry out activities to boost their team spirit.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey which they all see as a growth opportunity and a way to help their families.

Marta is part of this group.  She has a fruit shop where she sells fruit and vegetables in general.  What needs to be pointed out is the great desire she has to be able to gradually grow and improve her and her family’s life every day.  She strives also to be able to give her customers what they ask for to grow that way.

Marta is requesting this loan to buy fruit and vegetables in general to better stock her fruit shop which will help her realize her business plan that will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Del Perpetuo Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Perpetuo está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de la fundación paraguaya, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como un instrumento de ayuda para las señoras, donde 16 mujeres se encuentran por encima de la línea de pobreza gracias a su esfuerzo, pero son conscientes de que deben de seguir esforzándose.
Un ejemplo es la Sra. Tiburcia, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas, un alimento típico paraguayo, que se vende durante todo el año. Cuenta que le va bien en sus ventas, que gracias a su habilidad tiene muchos clientes, ayuda a su familia y va mejorando sus ingresos más y más.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos y crecer así.
texts.en:
“Virgen del Perpetuo” is in cycle number 12 Fundación Paraguaya’s committee program.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey as an instrument of help for the women.  Sixteen of them are above the poverty level thanks to their efforts but they are aware that they must continue striving.

One example is Tiburcia who sells ‘chipas’ [cheese buns], a traditional Paraguayan food that’s sold year-round.  She says that she does well with her sales; thanks to her skills she has many customers.  She helps her family and is gradually improving her income more and more.

Today, she’s requesting this loan to be able to buy chipas to continue with her sales, improve her income and thus grow.

loans.use: to buy "chipas" [cheese buns].

loans.name: Arnulfo De Jesús

texts.es: Arnulfo es un señor de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 19 años de edad. Desde que era pequeño siempre ha vivido en el campo, lugar donde su padre le enseño las labores agrícolas y de ganadería. Por falta de educación no le fue fácil conseguir oportunidades de empleo, debido a que no sabe leer, ni escribir, su única opción fue emplearse como reciclador en una chatarrería, donde labora hace ya 12 años; adicionalmente y para complementar sus ingresos, cuenta con algunas vacas lecheras y ganado de levante al que cría y cuida sobrepasando los obstáculos que se le presentan debido a que los insumos agrícolas son muy costosos y el precio de venta de la leche disminuye constantemente, generando una inestabilidad económica y una difícil situación en su hogar. Por este motivo, Arnulfo busca apoyo con el tercer ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca productora de leche y una ternera de levante, con el fin de aumentar su producción y poder mejorar los ingresos por las ventas, esto le ayudará a cumplir el sueño de salirse de su empleo como reciclador y dedicarse a su familia y al cuidado de sus animales, de esta forma podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia y brindarle a su hijo, la oportunidad que él nunca tuvo por falta de recursos… Educación.
texts.en: Arnulfo, 43, lives with his wife and his 19-year-old son. From a young age, he has always lived in the countryside, where his father taught him about farming and ranching. Due to a lack of education, it was not easy for him to find work opportunities. Because he does not know how to read or write, his only option was to be employed as a recycler at a scrapyard, where he has worked for 12 years. To complement his income, he has some dairy cows and breeding cattle that he raises and cares for, overcoming obstacles that present themselves, since farm supplies are expensive and the sale price of milk is constantly going down, which creates economic instability and a difficult situation in his house. This is why Arnulfo is asking for a third loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow and a weaned calf, with the goal of increasing production and improving his income through sales. This will help him achieve his dream of leaving his recycling job and dedicating himself to his family and caring for his animals. This way, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and give his son the opportunity that he never had due to a lack of resources...education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a weaned calf.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is 21 years old and lives at Paynesville North which has the largest local  market in Montsorrado. She and her fiancé live together. Her finance is not working. They have three children between 2 and 6. Two are in school and they all live at home. May describes herself as a hard-working lady. Since 2012, she has been running a table market where she sells pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways her customers respond to it. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest sister. She walks to buy her inventory since her market table is close to the local market. She sells from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. six day a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. for her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a shop. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, palm oil, bitter ball, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca es cliente antigua de la fundación, vive en la ciudad Luque, es una persona muy trabajadora, que se está esforzando por el sustento de su familia, comenta que tiene una una despensa  desde el año 2009.
También comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que luego, por medio de su esfuerzo pudo ir mejorando y creciendo, y poco a poco ir agrandando su negocio.
El préstamo que solicita lo quiere invertir en la compra de insumos de su despensa, como ser bebidas, golosinas, yerba, lácteos, etc. y obtener de esa manera mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Con esto obtendrá mejor margen de ganancias en su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de toda su familia.-
texts.en:
Francisca is a long-standing Fundación client.  She lives in the city of Luque and is a very hardworking person who is striving to support her family; she comments that she’s had a grocery store since 2009.

She also comments that she started out with very little but then by means of her effort was able to improve and to grow and to gradually enlarge her business.

She wants to use the loan she’s requesting to buy supplies for her store like beverages, snacks, herbal tea, dairy products, etc. thus obtaining a wider variety of goods to offer her customers.  With this, she’ll earn a better profit margin which will help her improve her and her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: One Word Group

texts.en:
Massah is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Massah is 31 years old and was born in Kenema city. She is married to a trader and the couple has 2 children one who is attending primary school and the other secondary school. Massah sells rice, pepper, etc. and has been in this business for many years now. 
With the help of this loan, Massah and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Massah is going to use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy rice and pepper in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice and pepper in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Mamoud S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This group of hard-working and dedicated teachers has applied for a loan of SLL 19,700,000 for the entire group in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Mamoud is the featured leader of this group. Born in Portloko, Mamoud is married to a trader. He has nine children in his name, five of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mamoud has been a school teacher for many years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials for the completion of a dwelling house he had begun constructing.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials for the completion of a dwelling house he had begun constructing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease a kitchen space and vehicle and to purchase necessary kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Marina, a sus 26 años de edad, es una mujer que con empeño y dedicación realiza las actividades agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres; desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de esterillas para caballo y gracias a todo ese tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad, ha logrado ser reconocida en el pueblo donde vive y sus alrededores, teniendo la oportunidad de ofrecer su producto a muchos clientes y adquirir dinero y recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. La titular es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, lo demuestra con el arduo trabajo que realiza a diario y además quiere preparar un terreno para sembrar cultivos de plátano, yuca y ñame, pero le hacen falta unos insumos, por lo cual solicita el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (semillas, abono, pesticidas, fungicidas), así complementará su negocio y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos, incrementará sus ingresos y esto le permitirá cumplir el sueño de ampliar sus cultivos y brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar y estabilidad económica para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marina, aged 26, is a woman who carries out the agricultural tasks with endeavor and dedication, as her parents have taught her. From an early age she has been selling horse mats and thanks to all the time she has spent doing this, she has gained a reputation in the village where she lives and its surroundings, giving her the opportunity to offer her products to a large number of clients, thus earning money and resources to help sustaining her family.

Marina is a very entrepreneurial person, visionary and with a strong desire for self-improvement, which she demonstrates by the hard work she carries out every day. She also wants to prepare a piece of land for cultivating plantain, cassava, and yam; but for this she needs inputs which is why she is applying for this loan. She wants to use it to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and fungicides. This way she can complement her business, offering a larger variety of products and increasing her income. This will help her to pursue her dream which is to amplify her crop farming and give her family more well-being and economic stability so that they can improve their lives.
