Su sueño es conseguir más clientes en otros municipios y departamentos del país,  con el objetivo de mejorar sus ganancias para darle una vida de calidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel, 31, is single and lives with his 11-year-old son in the Yoxaja rural community in Xojola Nahualá Sololá.  He is a kind, hard-working man who wants to provide for his family.  Currently he is involved in buying and selling bananas at the local market.

He has observed that this type of business brings in a good weekly income which allows him to support his family.  Several years ago he began this activity in an effort to improve his lifestyle.

Samuel is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 GTQ to expand his banana business and improve his customer services and income.  His dream is to attract more clients from other towns and departments in an effort to improve his profits and give his family a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To expand his banana business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo porque se encuentra en la temporada agrícola y requiere reforzar su actividad; esta inversión le permitirá comprar 8 quintales de abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros para utilizarlo  en la milpa y para el control de hierbas y plagas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener una cosecha más abundante libre de plagas para sacarlas  a la venta y para el consumo de su familia; hoy en día cuenta con mejores oportunidades  para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Martin finds himself in need of a new loan since it is the growing season and he wants to strengthen his efforts. This loan will allow him to buy 8 quintals of fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and fungicides and other items to use in the cornfield to control weeds and pests. 

He used the previous loan to obtain a better harvest free from pests which he used to feed his family and to sell. Nowadays he has better opportunities to help his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 8 quintals of fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and fungicides among other items.

loans.name: Nusratby

texts.ru: Нусратби честная и порядочная женщина. Она уже 4 цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе. Ей 52 года. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Детям 28, 25, 23 и 20 лет. После смерти мужа она обеспечивала и воспитывала детей сама. Нусратби было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами, так как она в течение 25 лет работает в школе. Сейчас дети выросли и стали помогать ей. Нусратби очень любит свою профессию и является одной из лучших учителей. Ее ученики работают в различных сферах общества, и Нусратби гордится ими. Нусратби уже давно мечтает купить автомашину марки Тико, но так как ее зарплата маленькая и она не может сделать сбережения, она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1700 долларов США для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nusratby is an honest and decent woman. She has already been given four cycles of credit by IMON. She is 52 years old. She is a widow and had 4 children. Her children are 20, 23, 25, and 28 years old. After the death of her husband, she provided for and raised her children alone. It was very hard for Nusratby to manage her families expenses, as she worked in a school for 25 years. Now her children are all grown up and have begun to help her. Nusratby really loves her job and is one of the best teachers in her school. Her pupils work in different spheres of society and Nusratby takes pride in them. Nusratby has dreamed of buying a Tico brand car for some time now, but as her salary is small and she is unable to have any savings, she has requested a loan. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1700 USD to buy a car. She awaits your kindness and relies upon your charity.

loans.use: To buy a TICO brand car.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 62-year-old farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of five grown-up children. Erlinda has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. She is also involved in a retail store business. Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional goods for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and additional goods for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Soleh

texts.ru: Солеху 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его дети еще несовершеннолетние. Его жена Шоира работает на поле. Солех для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью со всеми необходимыми средствами много лет работал в различных местах. 3 года назад он начал свой бизнес перевозкой грузов со своим мотороллером. Он перевозит товары бизнесменов, которые торгуют на местном рынке или людей, которые делают покупки на местном рынке. Солех хочет развевать бизнес, но его мотороллер имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ для покупки нового мотороллера. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Soleh is 42 years old. He is married and has three children in his care. His children are not yet grown up. His wife Shoira works in the fields. In order to provide his family with all the essentials, he has worked for many years in different places. Three years ago, he started his own shipping and transport business with his motorcycle. He transports businessmen's products, which are traded at the local market, or people, who shop at the local market. Soleh wants to develop his business, but his motorcycle is in bad shape. He is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle. He awaits your kindness and relies upon your charity.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle his transportation business.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana is 28 years old, married and a mother of two children, ages 1 and 3 years old. She currently does administration work and her husband works in the hospital. Together, they all live in a minority community in Kosovo. 

Mirjana has finally achieved her dream of owning her own home. They have managed to build a new house but they could not finish the facade and the bathroom. 
For this reason Mirjana is requesting a loan to pay for finishing the facade and the bathroom. This loan will help them to be able to finally move into their new house and improve their living conditions. 

She is hoping to have a better life for her children and offer them a better education. Mirjana is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To finish the facade and the bathroom of her house.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 26 years old. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. 

Her husband has a small rent-a-bike business. This is the only source of income for his family. Currently, he is interested to purchase a bike for his shop. Due to the lack of money, however, he finds it difficult.

Therefore Asma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. This will help him to improve his business, which will gradually increase his net income as well. Asma promises to pay back the loan amount on time. She is so thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a bike for her husband's rent-a-bike business.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 27 years old from the small town of Sagarejo in the Kakheti Region. She is a mother of two children (7 and 4 years old). Natia's husband works for Georgian Special Forces and gets a monthly salary. Besides that, the family owns a small vineyard and sells the grapes seasonally. 

Unfortunately, the existing income is not enough to make ends meet for the four-member family. So Natia decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan. But the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Natia’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 2,200 GEL, she will purchase second-hand clothing at wholesale prices and sell it in her community. She will set up a store and offer her customers a wide assortment and well-priced clothing for men, women and children. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Natia, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The start up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to set up a second-hand clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and an additional pig and ducks to raise.

loans.name: Hisni

texts.en:
Hisni lives in the southern part of Kosovo with his four children and his wife. His children are between ages of 12 and 17 years old. Hisni's wife is a housewife. In order for Hisni to earn a living, he has been working as an auto mechanic for the last 13 years. Because he is a very professional and hard worker, Hisni has gained and retained many customers through the years. 

Even now, his business continues to grow and expand.  Now, for the first time he is asking for a loan to purchase as an auto mechanic's lift. This loan will help him to generate even more income and attract and serve more customers. He hopes to save money for his family's future so he can achieve his goal of offering a better living conditions to his family. Hisni appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase as an auto mechanic's lift

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a resident of the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been engaged in a crab fishing business together with her husband for more than 12 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fishing nets. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more crabs and fish to sell in the market. In the future, Angelita hopes to make their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 46, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danny, a driver, and is the mother of their child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marissa has food stalls where she sells fruit shakes and some street foods. She has stalls in three schools and she has more than ten employees. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community and students. She earns a minimum of PHP 15,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy ingredients of fruits shakes, fish balls, siomai, kikiam and hotdogs for her business.

Marissa dreams to expand and have stalls in other schools. She hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients of fruit shakes, fish balls, siomai, kikiam and hotdogs for her business.

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en: Marizel is 36 years old, a single woman known as a lesbian in their village. She aims to become successful and financially stable in the future through her hog-raising business and small variety store to generate income. She plans to improve her piggery business but she has inadequate capital to do it. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 20-year-old married mother of one child, who has been working in preparing and selling mouneh (preserved food), at her house since three years ago.
Roula helps her husband in making their living, especially now that they have a small, beloved baby girl, whom they have to work hard to provide with the best living and education ever.

Roula is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy raw materials to start preparing and conserving them for the coming seasons.

Roula hopes to move her home-based business in the future to a wide store to display all of her products and increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to prepare and preserve.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
This is Marcelina. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marcelina hopes to expand her business and have more networks, and she dreams of giving her children an education and a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more herbal medicines and food supplements needed in her business.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 52 years old and a married man. He lives in a small village of Khulo District with his wife and three sons. Raul requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. They sell cheese at local markets. Besides this, they have a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Raul requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Raul has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Raul will renovate a flat to rent out. The rent will be an additional source of income for the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate a flat to rent out

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feeds, poultry baskets and medicine.

loans.name: Afrim

texts.en:
Afrim is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders for the previous loan he was given.  With this support he was able to repair and buy some new musical instruments and in turn has managed to improve his business due to the better quality sound he has been able to provide to his customers. 

Performing for celebrations and events is a seasonal job, based on weather and holiday schedules, so he also tried to save some money for when he cannot meet his family's daily expenses when business slows down. 

Now he is asking a second loan to renovate his bathroom that urgently needs it because it is very old and damaged. This loan will help him to improve the living conditions and environment for his family, keeping his family healthy. 

He hopes to continue to work as a musical performer in the future as he loves his work and hopes to be able to provide a more secure and stable life for his family. Afrim really appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for this second support!

loans.use: to renovate his bathroom.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Greetings from Pakistan! This is 47-year-old Allah Rakhi from Lahore. She is married and has six children. Her last-born attends primary school and is in class 5; the remaining children are doing jobs in different firms.

Her husband runs a retail business selling clothes for ladies and gentlemen. The business has been in operation for almost 10 years. He says the main challenges he faces are competition from bigger retailers who offer longer credit terms and also high import duties when bringing in goods from outside the country.

Allah Rakhi has requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 from BRAC Pakistan, in order to buy a variety of clothes to stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her more disposable income to buy food and pay rent and fees for the child in school.

In the future Allah Rakhi plans open more stalls around town and a clothes boutique. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the summer season to sell.

loans.name: Alaysa

texts.en:
This is Alaysa, 22, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alaysa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Alaysa hopes to expand her business and dreams that her whole family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Yona, who is in his late 30s, is married and has three children, one boy and two girls. His children are in school. 

Since 2008, he has had a retail shop, selling different products like airtime, dried foods, rice, beans, sugar, soaps, soft drinks, juices, soda, etc. He is doing fine with his enterprise as well as with his family. He starts working at 8 a.m. and works until 10 p.m. daily and is able to make good returns. 

This will be his 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he purchased more shop items like soaps and sugar. He usually purchases more sacks of rice during the harvest period at low prices and stores them up to resell later. With the profit received, he bought a plot of land and starting making bricks for house building. 

He will use this loan to replenish more items like rice, airtime, soft drinks, etc. He hopes to expand his shop by restocking more items.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group, "Loyola," which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more items like rice, airtime, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nienta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nienta est constitué de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Coro dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali); Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de vêtements, des chaussures, des produits cosmétiques (crème, pommade, …) et des tisanes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nantenin (la 1ère femme assise à l’extrême gauche) est une grande vendeuse de chaussures en plastiques à Kalaban Coro. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché en gros et effectue ses ventes au comptant à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle mixte. Madame Nantenin espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en condiments. Madame Nantenin  ambitionne  d’acheter une parcelle à usage d’habitation pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Nienta group is made up of four married women, mostly from monogamous households.  They have an average age of 35 with four children, on average. They all live in  Kalaban Coro in the administrative circle of Kati (second administrative region of Mali). They met through ties of neighborhood and through their income-generating activities at the market of Kalaban Coro. The members of the group have small businesses selling clothing, shoes, cosmetic products (cremes and pomades) and herbal teas. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Nantenin (the first woman seated at the far left) is an important seller of plastic shoes at Kalaban Coro. She buys her merchandise in the Grand Market wholesale and makes her sales for cash in Kalaban Coro to a mixed clientele. She hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in the activity and purchase the condiments needed by her household. Her goal is to buy a plot of land where her children can live.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all are in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo and rollers, etc. Her major business challenge is electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to open a retail shop for cosmetics and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food

loans.use: To buy braids, shampoo, hair treatments, oils and relaxers.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 54 years old and married. She is a mother of seven children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic. He is the only earning person in the family. His customers appreciate his services. 

Currently he needs spare parts for his shop. However, he does not have enough savings to purchase spare parts for his work. 

For that reason, Parveen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to purchase needed motorbike spare parts for his shop so that he can continue his work and respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband's mechanic shop.

loans.name: Yrsalatkan

texts.ru: Ырсалаткан, 52 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей (2 дочери и 2 сына). С 1992 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2 000 сом (KGS).  Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 7000  сом (KGS). Благодаря своему упорному труду и целеустремленности, Ырсалаткан на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 4 дойные коровы и 15 овец.Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Прибыль позволила Ырсалаткан размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ырсалаткан обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Ырсалаткан  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Yrsalatkan is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children (2 sons and 2 daughters). Since 1992, she has practiced farming - animal husbandry and crop farming, starting this business with 2000 som (KGS). Her monthly revenue from this business is 7000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work and determination, Yrsalatkan currently has an excellent farm: 4 dairy cows and 15 sheep. Her husband and daughter help her with the farm. The earnings have allowed Yrsalatkan to multiply the cattle in her household and thereby improve her family's well-being.  In order to further develop her agricultural business, Yrsalatkan requested a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. Yrsalatkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future expansion of the number of cattle on her farm.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Marisa Yanira

texts.es:
Marisa, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir más en la venta de ropa y para el fortalecimiento del mismo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar blusas, pantalones, faldas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas y aumento la clientela; las circunstancias familiares se han mejorado y asimismo las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Marisa needs a new loan to be able to invest more in her business selling clothes and to strengthen it. This investment will help her buy blouses, pants, and skirts among other things.

The previous loan helped her improve her sales and increased her clientele. Her family's cirucmstances have improved as well their economic conditions.

loans.use: buy blouses, pants, and skirts among other things.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working at preparing and selling Mouneh (special way of food conserving and production) for ten years. In 2010, she started her own business from home to help her husband with covering their family's expenses, especially because she has a child enrolled in a private school and the other is on the way. So they have to stay prepared for the increasing family needs.

Yousra is specialized in making Kishek, a traditional food prepared from groats mixed with skimmed yoghurt and spread over a blanket (after being left for several days in a big pot to keep on mixing and assuring they are in the stage of fermentation), to be exposed to sunlight to dry and then grind them as powder, to be cooked during the winter season by adding it to minced meat, garlic and water. It then looks like a thick, tasty, hot syrup specialized for cold seasons.

Yousra is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy big quantities of groats, skimmed yoghurt, plastic bags and a few other things to increase her business production. She will work hard to establish her own business outside her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials for her business development.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, es una persona de hogar, vive con su compañera de vida, su suegra y un hijo. El se dedica a la albañilería, carnicería y asimismo a la agricultura, dicha actividad lo aprendió por su propia cuenta después de trabajar mucho tiempo con sus padres, hoy en día lo realiza por sí mismo y lo hace desde hace 5 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas y pago de mozos, esto ayudara a obtener una mejor producción de maíz,  pipián y ajonjolí; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener mejores ganancias.
Su sueño es ampliar el cultivo y agregar otro tipo de actividad agrícola, adquirir ganado y ampliar su casa, asimismo brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a family man. He lives with his life's companion, his mother in law and a son. He works in bricklaying, butchering and in agriculture as well. He learned agriculture on his own after working with his parents for a long time. Now he does it on his own and has done so for 5 years.  

The loan he needs will allow him to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and to pay the workers. This will help him to obtain better production of corn, peppers and sesame. This investment will help him to obtain better profits. 

His dream is to expand his crops and add another agricultural activity, acquire cattle and enlarge his house. He also wants to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, pesticide and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de quatre  femmes toutes mariées dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 43ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Coro dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de  condiments, médicaments traditionnels et charbons de bois, du bois de chauffe etc. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Arhouna (la 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toutes sortes à Kalaban Coro. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter divers condiments tels que le poisson séché, le piment, les tomates fraiches, l’oignon et le Sounbala.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  et effectue ses ventes au comptant  à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Arhouna espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Madame Arhouna ambitionne acheter une parcelle à usage d’habitation pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This Benkadi group is made up of four women, all married in monogamous households. They have an average age of 43 and four children, on average. They all  live in Kalaban Coro in the administrative circle of Kati, (second administrative region of Mali.) They met through ties of neighborhood, family, and through their income-generating activities at the Kalaban Coro market. The members of the group have small businesses selling condiments, traditional medicines, charcoal, firewood, etc. With the intention of  increasing their working capital, the members of the group decided to join with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Arhouna (the first woman standing from right to left) is an important seller of all sorts of condiments in Kalaban Coro. She intends to use her loan to buy various condiments such as dried fish, peppers, fresh tomatoes, onions, and 'sounbala'. She stocks up in the Grand Market and makes her sales for cash at Kalaban Coro to a clientele mostly made up of women. 

With this loan, Madame Arhouna hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in the business and cover necessary expenses for her family. Madame Arhouna's goal is to buy a plot of  land where her children can live.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about six years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Her husband enjoys his work because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings. Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable because he has a regular income and has more free time. 

This will be her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time. Mehwish requested a sum of 25,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees); she will buy spare parts for the vehicle such as tires, bolts, headlights, tire tubes, etc.

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honor.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 37, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Erwin and is a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zenaida operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetable products in the community market. She buys a quantity of fruits and vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. 

Zenaida hopes that her business will grow bigger and have more stalls. She dreams to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda didn't pursue her studies in college. Despite that, she never fails to pursue her dream, maybe not in completing her education anymore but to succeed in the line of business. At 24 years, she is single and still living with her parents in a rural community.

Luz, as she is commonly called, is managing a hog-raising business. She aims to improve it and make it profitable, but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for her hogs' maintenance and further growth. She is hoping that someday, she will able to succeed in her business endeavor.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for her hogs' maintenance.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 38 years old and married to a farmer. They were blessed with two children and they live happily in a rural community. The main source of their living is thru farming. The couple help each other in cultivating their farm lot, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. 

Juanita also manages hog-raising to earn additional income. She plans to raise more pigs to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and piglets to raise. She is hoping someday that she will able to improve and sustain her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est constitué de 4 femmes mariées dont la moitié vit dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Coro dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de se ravitailler au comptant, elles ont adhéré au programme de prêt solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier 1er cycle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbons de bois, médicaments traditionnels, pagnes wax, brodés, bazins, d’habits pour enfants et de condiments. 
Mme BINTOU (femme assise de la gauche vers la droite) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de 10 complets d’habits pour enfants. Elle se ravitaille en habits au grand marché. La revente se fait  au comptant  et à crédit à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame BINTOU espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Madame BINTOU ambitionne acheter une parcelle à usage d’habitation pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group comprises four married women, two of whom live within monogamous households. The members of the group are, on average, 40 years old with five children each. They all live in Kalaban Coro, in the Cercle of Kati (second administrative region of Mali).  They know one another through neighborhood ties and also through their income-generating activities at the Kalaban Coro market.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to boost their financial capacity and pay cash for the goods they want to purchase.  This is their first loan cycle.

They sell charcoal, traditional medications, wax, embroidered and damask "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics), condiments and children's clothes.

Bintou, first from the left in the front row, plans to use her loan to buy ten sets of children's clothes.  She buys clothes at the Grand Market and resells for cash or on credit in Kalaban Coro, to a customer base which mostly consists of women.

Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to meet her family's needs.  Her ambition is to buy a plot of land to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children; two are in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo and rollers. Her major business challenge is electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to improve her sales that of late have been low and also buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a box of rollers, relaxers, hair treatments and shampoo.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana, 36, is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income. Her husband is a goverment employee, whose income is too low to cover their household expenses. 

Shabana herself has been running a beauty salon for 2 years. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial creams, etc. for her salon. With the profits she will first pay back her loan to Kiva, and then she will purchase more varieties of cosmetic products for the salon. Shabana’s dream is to open a new beauty parlor and to get good profits from that. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial creams, etc. for her salon

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda is a married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 8 years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other supplies. With this, her husband will be able to increase his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell to the market. 

Bernalda dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, like for their food, and to pay the school fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others.

loans.name: Besarion

texts.en:
Besarion is 64 years old. He lives with his wife, Giuli, in a small village of Khulo district. Geiuli is a librarian; she works at the local library and gets 200 GEL (Georgia Lari) in a month. Besarion is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. He is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest, which is sold at local markets. 

As the existing income is only seasonal from agricultural activities and is not enough for the family, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Besarion applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

With a loan of $3,000, Besarion will open an auto spare parts shop. As the shop is opened, he will be able to generate monthly income and thus improve their living conditions. This credit will be a great support for the family. Besarion is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to open an auto spare parts shop.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is a 47-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. A father of a 17-year-old daughter, he runs a 'sari-sari' (variety) store business. He sells various items like eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods and  beverages. He requested a loan of 7000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks and other various goods. In the future, Francisco would like to expand his sari-sari (variety) store to continue send his child to school as well as to provide  his family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and other various goods

loans.name: Klara

texts.en:
Klara is 59 years old, living in the Khobi district with her husband who is a plumber and gets a small monthly income. Klara is a cleaner at the local culture house and her income is approximately $50 per month. As their existing income is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Klara decided to start up a clothing sales business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. 

 Klara’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfied their requirements. She received this credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With this loan of 300 USD she will purchase used clothing at wholesale prices and sell it in her community door-to-door.  Her regular customers will be her co-workers and neighbors.  She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children. 

 It is obvious that the job is hard for Klara, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Khobi district of West Georgia. He is 50 years old, a single man living with his retired father. George is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, two calves, two pigs and nine piglets. With the received milk George produces cheese which is sold from his house among the locals. Besides, he grows kiwis and maize on the family-owned agricultural land and sells them at the local open market. George’s father helps him running family business in spite of his age.

Now, George has decided to start a new business so as to earn a more stable income. With the received credit, George will purchase a second-hand car and serve local people as a taxi driver. 

The Kiva loan will be a great financial help for him. George awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Ayant pour idée de devenir grossiste et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille, madame Adjoa demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (mèches et produits cosmétiques). Le profit tiré de cette lui permettra de répondre à ses besoins. Âgée de 43ans, elle a un enfant de 07ans qui vient de commencer les études. Adjoa expose ses produits dans un marché avec une ancienneté de 13ans.
texts.en: With the idea of becoming a wholesaler and ensuring a bright future for her family, Ms. Adjoa is asking for an initial loan from WAGES to supply herself with merchandise (hair extensions and cosmetic products). The profits earned from this will enable her to respond to her needs. She is 43 years old and has a 7-year-old child, who just started going to school. Adjoa displays her goods at a market, and she has thirteen years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 69 años esta casado y tiene 4 hijos ya mayores e independientes por eso actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa. Juan tiene un hotel que lleva por nombre “Hotel Vacors”. Comenta que se decidió por un negocio de este rubro ya que no había establecimientos similares y porque la ciudad aun no se desarrollaba completamente. Con el paso de los años fue mejorando el servicio que brindaba poniendo más habitaciones y renovando alguna de sus instalaciones manteniendo la buena atención que lo caracteriza. Cuenta con el apoyo de 6 ayudantes quienes son su personal de confianza en el servicio que brinda. La localidad donde se ubica su negocio se ha convertido en punto de parada obligatoria para trabajadores de proyectos pertenecientes al sector privado que visitan la localidad. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para realizar la renovación de dos habitaciones y necesitará contratar a una persona para que realize este trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is 69 years old and married with four adult children. He lives in his own home with his wife. Juan owns a hotel named "Hotel Vacors". He mentioned that he decided to take on this business because there were no similar establishments around and because the city had not yet developed completely. With the pass of time he continued to improve the service that he offered by adding new rooms and renovating some of the facilities to maintain the good service that the hotel is characterized by. 

The area in which his business is located has become an obligatory stop for workers for private sector projects. This is his second loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support that he receives to keep getting ahead. He is committed to paying his loan installments on time. On this occasion he hopes to receive 3000 nuevos soles in order to carry out the renovation of two hotel rooms, including to contract a worker to take on this renovation.

loans.use: to renovate two hotel rooms.

loans.name: Courageuse Group

texts.fr:
Courageuse est un groupe constitué de quatre  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 27ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Coro dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de lait en poudre, de couscous arabes, de pagnes wax et la teinture et vente de bazins. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (la  1ere femme assise de la droite vers la gauche) a une grande renommée dans la teinture. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 kg de colorants de différentes couleurs et de la potasse. Elle s’approvisionne en ses produits au grand marché. 
Pour teindre une pièce bazin, on chauffe de l’eau à plus de 100 degrés puis on fait le mélange des colorants et la potasse selon le goût de la cliente. 
Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans la même activité et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. 
Madame Fatoumata ambitionne de participer aux différentes foires internationales.
texts.en:
"Courageuse" is a group composed of four married women for the most part in monogamous households. The women average 27 years of age and four children each, all living in Kalaban Coro, in Cercle de Kati (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and through their revenue-generating businesses at the market in Kalaban Coro. The group members have small-scale businesses selling powdered milk, Arab couscous, damask fabrics, and Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and they dye cloth.

With the goal of increasing their capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Fatoumata (sitting first from the right in the photo) is really renowned for her dyed cloth. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 kg of dyes of different colors and some potash. She gets her supplies of these products at the big market. 

To dye a length of damask fabric, you heat some water to over 100 degrees and then mix in some dyes and the potash, per a customer's wishes. 

With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in the same business and ensuring her children's education. Her ambition is to participate in the different international fairs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for dyeing cloth

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is an 18-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working selling beauty cosmetics for three years.

Karen is a hard worker; she puts so much effort into expanding her business to open one day a shop of her own outside her house, but in the meantime she doesn't have enough cash to take this huge step forward.

Today, she is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection. She will also use part of the loan to pay what is left from her daughter's baptism expenses.

Karen is hoping that one day she will make her own and her family's dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a una nieta.  Se dedica a la venta de ropa en la ciudad,  donde tiene instalado su local; prácticamente tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa ya que anteriormente solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos en su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa de todas las edades; para incrementar la mercadería disponible y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes; ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. De los mismos ingresos que obtenga, ella los invertirá el negocio con la finalidad de seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.

Espera,  obtener mayores ganancias ya que tendrá a disposición de los clientes una mayor variedad de prendas de vestir y esto le generara un porcentaje de ganancia que le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Ella comenta que su propósito, es seguir trabajando con su negocio de la venta de ropa que es su fuente de ingresos y ademas es un trabajo que le gusta mucho; ya que tiene muchos años de dedicarse al comercio y tener la oportunidad de trabajar con la fundación Campo con el apoyo del crédito.
texts.en:
Dominga is 63 years old. She lives with a granddaughter. She works selling clothing in the city where she has a locale. She has spend about 10 years selling clothes, and before she was a homemaker. 

The loan she is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy clothing for all ages to increase the available merchandise and offer more variety to her customers. This is her only source of income. 

She hopes to obtain more profits since she will have a wider variety of customers for the clothing and this will generate a profit margin that will allow her to keep growing in her business.

She says that her objective is to continue working in the business of selling clothes, which is her source of income and also work that she really enjoys.  She has spent many years as a merchant and having the opportunity to work with Fundación Campo with the help of the lending.

loans.use: to buy clothing for all ages.

loans.name: Skarlet Ramona

texts.es: Skarlet, es originaria de Telica Municipio de León, tiene 21años d edad , es soltera y vive en la casa de su mamá junto con su hermana menor . Ella se dedica atender una pulpería desde hace 2 años, al mismo tiempo vende ropa de manera ambulante. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso las remesas que su mama le envía. Solicita el crédito para surtir su pulpería y comprar productos tales como: arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, pasta dental, productos enlatado etc. Su meta futura es tener una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Skarlet, who comes from Telica Municipio de León, is 21 years old. She is single and lives in her mother's house with her younger sister. She has been running a small grocery store for the last 2 years at the same time as selling clothing as a street vendor. Another source of income she has is the money which her mother sends her. 

She is asking for the loan in order to stock her grocery store and to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, toothpaste, tinned goods etc. Her goal for the future is to have a shop selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, toothpaste, tinned goods etc.

loans.name: Magaly Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Divino Niño de Tohalla se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Magaly, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, el menor de ellos tiene 6 años  de edad,  4 de sus hijos estudian tres en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Magaly se dedica a la cría de chanchos y  aves de corral para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, ella compra los chanchos cuando están pequeños, los mantiene por un tiempo adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta la zona a comprar estos animalitos para que estos los lleven a otras ciudades donde los faenan y comercializan la carne, ella viene realizando esta labor por más de 8 años con lo cual se gana algo para sacar adelante a sus hijos sobretodo en sus gastos de los estudios.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar alimento y medicinas para los chanchos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño de Tohalla” (Devine Child of Tohalla) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.

Here is where Magaly lives. She is 39, she is married and she has five children. 4 of her children are students: three attend high school and her youngest, who is 6 years old, goes to primary school. Her husband is a driver.

Magaly engages in breeding pigs and chickens in a small farm located close to her house. She buys piglets to breed until they are ready to be sold and then she sells them to traders coming to her community to buy these animals. The traders then bring them to other cities where they are slaughtered and their meat sold. She has been engaged in this activity for more than 8 years, and thanks to this job she earns an income she uses to provide for her children, especially for they school expenses.

The new loan she is requesting will be used to buy animal feed and medicines for her piglets. She has been a member of this Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the support she receives through the loans.

She dreams of offering the best to her children.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and medicines for her piglets.

loans.name: Koffissé

texts.fr: Père de 02 enfants (05 et 03ans) dont 01 scolarisé, Koffisé est depuis 01an revendeur de quincaillerie dans sa boutique. Il emploie une personne et sollicite un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandises (peintures, chaux, faume…) afin de répondre aux besoins de la famille. Son désir est de devenir un grossiste et assurer une bonne éducation à la famille. Il est âgé de 34ans et marié à une couturière.
texts.en: A father of two children (5 and 3 years old), of whom one is in school, Mr. Koffisé has been selling hardware for a year in his store. He employs one person and is requesting an initial loan to purchase some supplies (paints, chalk, 'faume',…) to meet the needs of his family. His wish is to become a wholesaler and ensure a good education for his family. He is 34 years old and married to a dressmaker.

loans.use: to purchase paint, chalk, etc. to sell in his hardware store

loans.name: Akper

texts.en:
Akper is a 46-year-old, married man. He lives with his wife and two sons in the small village of Sagarejo district. His elder son is a student and another is working locally as a hired worker. 

Akper is an artisan and works on building construction. Since the existing income is not enough for his four-member family, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and his lack of experience. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, Akper applied for the credit to Micro Finance Organization Credo (MFO Credo). His request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of USD 5,000, Akper will purchase five milking cows and two calves. As the cattle are purchased, his wife will start producing dairy products, which will be sold locally, at a good price. This will be additional monthly income for their family. 

As the income will be increased, the family will be able to improve their living conditions as well expand the business for the future. With support of the start-up program, Akper will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase five milking cows and two calves.

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr: Afin de développer son activité de vente de brochettes et de cafétéria, Mr koku sollicite un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandise (viande de bœuf, sucre, lait,..). Le profit l’aidera à assurer un avenir meilleur à la famille (il a deux enfants de 10 et 07ans qui sont à l’école et une femme). Mr Koku âgé de 41ans a une ancienneté d’01an.
texts.en: To develop his business selling kebabs and café services, Mr. Koku is requesting an initial loan to stock up on supplies (beef, sugar, milk, …). The profit will help him to ensure a better future for his family. (He has a wife and two children, aged 10 and 7 years old, who are in school.). Mr. Koku is 41 years old and has a year of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase beef, sugar, milk, ...

loans.name: Kodjowa

texts.fr: Âgée de 34ans et maman de 02 enfants scolarisés, Kodjowa couturière de profession, confectionne et revend des trousseaux bébé à domicile. Elle désire répondre au mieux aux besoins des clients c’est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter des matières premières (tissus..) pour la confection de trousseau. Madame Kodjowa espère développer son activité et contribuer au besoin de la famille. Elle est mariée à un revendeur avec une ancienneté de 02ans.
texts.en: A mom with two children in school, Kodjowa is 34 years old and a seamstress by trade. She makes and sells baby clothing and accessories. She would like to do better responding to the needs of her customer, and so she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to purchase some supplies (fabrics…) to sew her products. Ms. Kodjowa hopes to develop her business and help meet the needs of her family. She is married to a retail, and she has two years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make baby clothing and accessoies

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has one child, who goes to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop at the market. She receives additional income from farming. She has been in business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice and flour. Her major business challenges are transportation and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: José Modesto

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad, esta soltero. Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tenia 8 años de edad, prácticamente a trabajado toda su vida en este rubro, donde fue su papá el que le enseño todo lo que sabe y lo desempeña de una forma muy propia y ordenada. Ademas de la agricultura también siembra tomate al aire libre para consumo de su familia y lo demás lo vende y en ocasiones regala tomates a los familiares que no tienen recursos para comprarle.
       
Los insumos que utiliza para  la siembra de maíz como fertilizantes y herbicidas, los adquiere en en la ciudad. El tiempo que tarda el bus en llegar al cantón desde la ciudad es de 45 minutos y le toca cargar en la espalda los insumos  por una calle que esta en muy malas condiciones hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 sacos de abono y 2 Litros de herbicidas. Se le estará apoyando para que pueda comprar los insumos que necesitara para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y así pueda tener su cultivo en buenas condiciones y con un manejo mas adecuado.

Para una mejor alimentación de su familia; porque generara mas ingresos. Don José, quiere seguir produciendo granos básicos como lo ha venido haciendo desde hace mucho tiempo atrás.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and single. He has worked in agriculture since he was 8 years old, so he has worked in this area for practically all his life. His father taught him everything that he knows and he does it in a very particular and ordered way. Besides farming he also plants tomatoes for his family to consume and sell and on occasion give away to relatives who don't have the resources to buy from him.
       
The materials he uses to plant corn, such as fertilizer and herbicides, he gets in the city. The time it takes the bus to arrive at the canton from the city is 45 minutes and he has to carry the materials on his back to his house on a street that is in very poor condition.

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer and 2 liters of herbicide. It will be a help so that he can buy the materials that he will need to grow 7,000 square meters of corn. This way, his crop can be in good condition with more adequate management. 

To better feed his family, because he wants to generate more income, José wants to keep producing basic grains like he has done for a very long time.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer and 2 liters of herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five bales of wheat flour and twenty liters of cooking oil, and to rennovate her food canteen.

loans.name: Madona Group

texts.en: Fatuma, who is in her early 30s, is married and has three children, a girl and two boys. Two of the children attend school, and the other is still too young for school. She has been running a grocery business for one year and six months now. She works from 3 pm to 12 midnight daily and is able to make a good profit per month. This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she bought more soft drinks, beers and spirits. Fatuma also bought salon equipment, two driers and a steamer in preparation for opening a beauty salon. With the profits she earned, she covered school fees and household expenses, and she reinvested in the business and saved the remainder in a bank. She will use this loan to increase her stock of drinks. She dreams of open more grocery stores in other areas.  She will share this loan with the other members of Madona Group, which consists of 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en: Desideria is a married woman and the mother of nine children, from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in retail sales of cosmetics products, such as make-up, perfume and lotions. She is also involved in the rice-farming business. Desideria is applying for a loan to buy more fertilizer for the farm and to buy more products for her cosmetics business, such as perfumes and lotions. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business, as well as her income. In the future, Desideria hopes to make her business a success, and a sustainable one. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for the farm and to buy more products for her cosmetics business, such as perfumes and lotions

loans.name: 04-07-14-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hạnh has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase candy, milk and drinks to resell. Hạnh has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hạnh is 61 years old and she is single with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents because her children are grown-up.

Hạnh is the group leader of the 04-07-14-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase candy, milk and drinks to resell.

loans.name: Vainqueurs Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO est maintenant  responsable du groupe VAINQUEURS car B. MELISSA ne fait plus partie du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 18mois. Personne ne va à l’école.
Mme est restauratrice depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz et des condiments. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en: Ms. ZENABO is now the official of the group VAINQUEURS, since B. MELISSA no longer belongs to the group. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 18 months old. None are attending school. Ms. ZENABO has been a restauranteur for three years. She gets her supplies from a market in Toecin. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase 2 sacks of rice and some condiments. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to purchase a parcel of land.

loans.use: to purchase rice and condiments for her restaurant

loans.name: Snezana

texts.en:
Snezana is 29 years old and is married. She is a mother of two children, aged seven and nine, and lives in a minority community of Kosovo. Snezana works as medical sister in a hospital and her husband is teacher in a secondary school. 

Snezana owns a small old house that is need of renovation and has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. Now she is in need of a loan to reconstruct the roof and to put a new façade on her house. The loan will help her to improve her living conditions. Without the loan she will never be able to do such renovations and repairs that will allow her family to live a normal and healthy life. She really appreciates this help!

loans.use: To reconstruct the roof and to put a new façade on her house.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Kotognontala, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dioila quartier Dougoukonon, commune de Dioila, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. elles font le commerce de charbon de bois, des condiments et  de  la restauration.                                                   
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises.
La cliente Assitan  la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 50kg d’oignon, 25kg de sel et 3 cartons de cube maggi. L’achat se fait chaque semaine. Ces produits seront vendus en détail pour réaliser un bénéfice par semaine 30.000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The group Kotognontala is composed of married women, who average 32 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in Dioila, in the Dougoukonon district, Commune de Dioila, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro  (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in charcoal and condiments, and they work in food service. 

The women of the group Kotognontala are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase their merchandise. 

This client, Assitan, who is second from the left in the photo, intends to purchase 50 kg of onions, 25 kg of salt, and 3 boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes. Purchases are made each week. These products will be sold retail to make a weekly profit of 30,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 6 quintals of manure, poisons and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bales of wheat flour, a sack of sugar and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Malina

texts.en:
Malina is 61 years old and gets a retirement pension. She lives in the Senaki District of West Georgia with her grown son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (three and five years old).  Malina’s son is an artisan and earns a small monthly income. In addition the family grows maize on the family-owned agricultural land and sells the harvest at the local open market. 

Malina has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected, due to her lack of experience in a new business. Experience is usually demanded by local credit providers. Malina requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-start-up credits with easier conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Malina will purchase used clothing and sell it from her house among her neighbors. She will begin her entrepreneurial activity with a wide assortment of merchandise and high sales volume. This will increase the family's income. She wants to develop her business further and reinvest the increased income in trading. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. She is grateful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Faïda, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dioïla, quartier Dougoukonon, commune de Dioila, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon de bois, de l’habillement, des condiments et de la restauration 
Les femmes du groupe Faïda sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leur marchandise.
La cliente Fanta  la première personne à partir de la gauche, est vendeuse de condiments. Elle détient une grande table sur laquelle elle expose de nombreux produits de condiments Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  du sel, du Soumbala, de l’oignon de l’aubergine, de la tomate, de laurier et des poivrons. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The group Faïda is composed of married women, who average 32 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in Dioila, in the Dougoukonon district, Commune de Dioila, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro  (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in charcoal, clothing, and condiments, and they work in food service. 

The women of the group Faïda are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase their merchandise. 

This client, Fanta, who is first from the left in the photo, is a vendor of condiments. She owns a large table where she displays a number of condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase salt, 'soumbala', onions, eggplant, tomatoes, bay leaves, and bell peppers. She gets her supplies from wholesalers and sells the goods retail, cash or credit, to a customer base composed essentially of women. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Betsy Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Divino Niño de Tohalla se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Betsy, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 años de edad y un bebe de 3 meses de nacido, el mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella como buena esposa realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su labor, el tiene una fábrica de ladrillos (material utilizado en el campo de la construcción), con el trabajan cuatro personas a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual por su trabajo, ellos trabajan de lunes a viernes y si hay muchos pedidos hasta los sábados y domingos, una vez elaborado los ladrillos los entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta la localidad para luego  llevar  a distribuir a otras ciudades.  Gracias a esta actividad ellos salen adelante así como también las personas que trabajan con el ya que con su trabajo ellos también pueden llevar el pan diario a su hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar arcilla para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así ella puede colaborar con la carga familiar. 

Su sueño es que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño de Tohalla” (Devine Child of Tohalla) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.

Here is where Betsy lives. She is 21 years old, she is married and she has two children: one is 5 years old, the second is a baby aged 3 months. Her eldest child goes to school. Her husband is a craftsman.

Being a good wife, Betsy is asking for a loan on behalf of her husband so he can use it for his job. He owns a factory producing brinks (a product used in constructions): four people work for him and he pays their wages on a monthly baser. They work form Mondays to Fridays and even Saturdays and Sundays if they have many orders to deal with.
